  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-911a1db5f735c0a6c57690447b3cfc30" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-show-hide-faq-hierarchy view-id-stanford_show_hide_faq_hierarchy view-display-id-grouping_no_title_block view-dom-id-d18ec19af8ec23f2227c05a538f63808">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <h3>Graduate Program</h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-770" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-770" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>How long does it take to get a PhD in Anthropology at Stanford?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-770">
<p>The Ph.D. program allows the student to develop a flexible program reflecting special research interests, under the supervision of a faculty committee chosen by the student. Students are encouraged to plan for completion of all work for the Ph.D. in five years.</p>
<p>Ph.D. students in Anthropology must complete a minimum of 135 quarter units with a minimum grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 (B). The maximum allowable number of transfer units is 45.<br />
		The typical time to degree is approximately 6 years, although it is quite possible to complete all the requirements in 5 years. A typical schedule is as follows:</p>
<ul><li>Years 1 and 2 – coursework and teaching assistance,</li>
<li>Year 3 – qualifying exams and research proposal,</li>
<li>Year 4 – approved dissertation research, typically in the field,</li>
<li>Years 5 and 6 – research, analysis, data collection, write-up, teaching assistance and oral examination – Dissertation defense.</li>
<p>For additional information please see the <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofhumanitiesandsciences/anthropology/">Stanford University Bulletin</a>, the <a href="https://www.stanford.edu/dept/anthropology/cgi-bin/web/?q=system/files/1213gradprogram.pdf">Anthropology Graduate Program Flyer</a>, and the <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-programs/about/doctoral-program">department graduate program webpage</a>.</p>
</ul>
<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-772" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-772" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Are there different tracks of specialization within the graduate program in Anthropology?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-772">
<p>Culture and Society and Archaeology are the two tracks of specialization in the doctoral program. Within these tracks, students may explore a range of fields of study including medical anthropology and ecological and environmental anthropology. Examples of the varying <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/people/faculty">faculty</a> and <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/people/students">student</a> areas of study can be found in their respective profiles online. Although, the tracks are informal and at the department-level, only, they are an important way for the department to identify the student’s developing research.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-774" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-774" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>How can I find out about faculty research and faculty contact information?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-774">
<p>The department faculty and their research interests are listed online at <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/people/faculty" target="_blank">Anthropology Faculty</a>. Current PhD students in the Department of Anthropology may be contacted by visiting <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/people/students" target="_blank">Anthropology Graduate Students</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-4 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-776" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-776" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>How can I find out about graduate student research and graduate student contact information?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-776">
<p>Current PhD students in the Department of Anthropology may be contacted by visiting <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/people/students" target="_blank">Anthropology Graduate Students</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-5 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-778" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-778" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>What is the language requirement for the PhD in Anthropology?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-778">
<p>PhD candidates must prove competence in a foreign language by the end of spring quarter of their Second Year. The chosen language may be related to field research or scholarly work.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-6 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-780" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-780" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>What is the teaching requirement for the PhD in Anthropology? </h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-780">
<p>The Department requires one quarter of Teaching Assistantship in the Second Year and at least one quarter of Teaching Assistantship in the Fifth Year. The Department requires students in the Second Year cohort to attend a Teaching Assistantship Training workshop at the beginning of the academic year.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-7 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-782" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-782" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>If I have prior graduate work, can it be transferred into the PhD degree program?  Will this accelerate my doctoral degree program?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-782">
<p>After at least one quarter of enrollment in the first year, students pursuing a PhD may apply for transfer credit for up to 45 units of graduate work done at another institution.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-8 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-784" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-784" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>If I have prior graduate work, can it be transferred into the MA program in Anthropology?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-784">
<p>No, prior graduate work may not be transferred or credited toward the MA degree program.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-9 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-786" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-786" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Does the MA degree program lead into the PhD degree program?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-786">
<p>No, transferring from the MA degree program to the PhD degree program is not usually permitted. Anthropology MA applicants whose ultimate goal is the Anthropology PhD program should apply directly to the PhD degree program.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-10 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-788" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-788" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Do I have to have an MA or other graduate work before I apply to the PhD program?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-788">
<p>No, applicants to the PhD program are not required to have an MA before applying to the PhD program. Less than one third of an entering PhD cohort will have obtained a masters degree.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-11 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-790" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-790" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>My most recent degree is not from an anthropology program. Will this adversely affect my graduate application?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-790">
<p>No, applicants are not required to have an Anthropology background. However, a background in the behavioral/ and or social sciences would be expected. In addition, the applicant would be expected to have a foundation in social science theory and the ability to do analysis in the social sciences.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-12 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-792" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-792" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>How can I obtain more information from the Anthropology Department regarding my interest in graduate studies?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-792">
<p>Please refer to the <a href="http://www.stanford.edu/dept/registrar/bulletin/">University Bulletin</a>, <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions" target="_blank">Department Admissions</a> website, and <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions" target="_blank">Registrars Office of Graduate Admissions</a> website for more information. Contact information for graduate students including a description of their topic and area(s) of interest is also available at the Department website under <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/people/students" target="_blank">Graduate Students</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-13 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-794" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-794" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Is funding offered to PhD students in Anthropology?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-794">
<p>The Department of Anthropology offers five years of graduate funding (based on the availability of funds) for the PhD program, through a combination of fellowships and assistantships, covering full tuition and a living stipend. The fellowships are usually given for five consecutive years of graduate study. In addition to the graduate funding offer, the PhD student is also offered funding for two summers of pre-field summer research; and health insurance coverage during the academic year (autumn, winter and spring quarters).</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-14 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-796" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-796" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Is funding offered to MA students in Anthropology?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-796">
<p>There is no financial support available through the Department of Anthropology to support students in the graduate Masters program. For more information about other funding opportunities, please contact the Student Services Officer directly via email or telephone at <a href="mailto:selleck@stanford.edu" rel="nofollow">selleck@stanford.edu</a> or 650-723-4641.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-15 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-798" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-798" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Is there a difference between department funding support and financial aid?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-798">
<p>Although, departmental funding support is sometimes referred to as ‘Financial Aid’ this funding is distinct from federal or other funding that an individual student may apply for through the <a href="http://www.stanford.edu/dept/finaid/grad/">Financial Aid</a> office of Stanford University. Department funding support for PhD students is funding provided from the School of Humanities and Sciences by way of the Department for the purpose of supporting the PhD student’s living expenses as well academic and research expenses throughout the PhD degree program.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-16 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-800" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-800" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Is Stanford on a quarter or semester system?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-800">
<p>Stanford is on the Quarter System. For more information about Stanford’s schedule, please go to the <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/registrar/academic-calendar">Stanford Academic Calendar</a> published by the Office of the Registrar.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-17 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-802" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-802" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Where can I find out more information about course offerings in Anthropology?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-802">
<p>Information about current Anthropology course offerings can be found on our Department website under <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/node/847" rel="nofollow">Courses</a>. Course listings beyond the current quarter can be viewed in <a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/CourseSearch/search?view=catalog&amp;catalog=&amp;page=0&amp;q=ANTHRO&amp;filter-catalognumber-ANTHRO=on&amp;filt">Stanford Bulletin Explore Courses</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-18 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-804" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-804" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Where can I find information about graduate degrees in Anthropology?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-804">
<p>Information about the department’s Doctoral and Masters degree programs, please review the information located on the <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-program/about">Department web pages</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-19 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-806" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-806" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Where can I find information about graduate housing at Stanford University?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-806">
<p>Information about campus housing for graduate students can be found on <a href="http://www.stanford.edu/dept/rde/shs/index.htm">Stanford’s Student Housing</a> website under <a href="http://www.stanford.edu/dept/rde/shs/grad/pros_students.htm">Prospective Students</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-20 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-808" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-808" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Where can I find information about the estimated cost of living at Stanford University?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-808">
<p>Information about the estimated cost of living at Stanford as a graduate student can be found on <a href="http://www.stanford.edu/dept/finaid/grad/budget/index.html">The Student Budget</a> website. Remember that this is only an estimate, your actual expenses may be different.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-21 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-810" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-810" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Does Stanford offer grant and loan opportunities to graduate students?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-810">
<p>Information about sources of Graduate student funding can be found at <a href="http://vpge.stanford.edu/funding/sources.html" title="http://vpge.stanford.edu/funding/sources.html">http://vpge.stanford.edu/funding/sources.html</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-22 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-812" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-812" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Will admission to the MA program help increase my chances of being admitted to the doctoral degree program?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-812">
<p>Admission to the Master's degree program does not increase the probability of admission to the doctoral degree program. If a current Stanford University MA student applies to the PhD degree program, the applicant will be considered equally with all other graduate applicants.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-23 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-814" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-814" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>What is the annual cost of attending your program?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-814">
<p>The tuition for the 2015-2016 academic year can be located at <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/registrar/students/tuition-fees_15-16" title="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/registrar/students/tuition-fees_15-16">http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/registrar/students/tuition-fees_15-16</a></p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-24 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-816" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-816" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Is there an additional or separate process to apply for department funding or for financial aid?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-816">
<p>The Department of Anthropology usually offers identical five-year funding packages to all admitted PhD students, with two additional summer quarters of funding. Funding is intended to cover the applicable tuition costs, Stanford Cardinal Care health insurance expenses, and various living expenses in the form of direct stipend, teaching assistantships or pre-doctoral research assistantships. The department, with the School of Humanities and Sciences, is also committed to sponsoring students' involvement in professional activities and may reimburse many of the expenses for research travel, summer language study, and participation in academic conferences. Applicants to the graduate PhD degree program in Anthropology do not need to submit an additional application for funding at the time when the graduate application is submitted. The department encourages students in all stages of the PhD degree program to apply for funding from intra and extramural funding sources.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-25 views-row-odd views-row-last">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-818" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-818" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Are there funding opportunities appropriate for application by a graduate applicant before admission to a graduate     program? </h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-818">
<div>
	<p>Listed below, are just a few of the agencies providing graduate fellowships. Applicants are urged to consult funding references for additional sources of support.</p>
	<p>NSF Graduate Research Fellowship Program <a href="http://www.nsfgrfp.org/" title="http://www.nsfgrfp.org/" rel="nofollow">http://www.nsfgrfp.org/</a></p>
	<p>Ford Minority Predoctoral Fellowship Program <a href="http://sites.nationalacademies.org/PGA/FordFellowships/PGA_047958" title="http://sites.nationalacademies.org/PGA/FordFellowships/PGA_047958" rel="nofollow">http://sites.nationalacademies.org/PGA/FordFellowships/PGA_047958</a></p>
	<p>Mellon Mays Predoctoral Research Grants <a href="http://www.ssrc.org/fellowships/mellon-mays-predoctoral-research-grants/" title="http://www.ssrc.org/fellowships/mellon-mays-predoctoral-research-grants/" rel="nofollow">http://www.ssrc.org/fellowships/mellon-mays-predoctoral-research-grants/</a></p>
	<p>Various Foreign Language and Area Studies grants</p>
</div>
<p> </p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div><div id="block-views-stanford-media-media" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-media view-id-stanford_media view-display-id-media view-dom-id-af695758c17191f6fb5caf598c7a0a95">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> FAQ for the Graduate Program Application Process </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-918" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/admission/faq/faq-graduate-program-application-process" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="FAQ for the Graduate Program Application Process" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-911a1db5f735c0a6c57690447b3cfc30" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-show-hide-faq-hierarchy view-id-stanford_show_hide_faq_hierarchy view-display-id-grouping_no_title_block view-dom-id-934b95db98c76ac460fa70a1e48d61a7">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <h3>Application Process</h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-850" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-850" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Am I eligible to apply for the PhD program in Anthropology?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-850">
<p>You are eligible for admission to graduate programs at Stanford as long as you have either completed a bachelor’s degree from a U.S. college or university accredited by a regional accrediting association; or completed an international degree that is equivalent to a U.S. bachelor’s degree from a college or university of recognized standing.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-852" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-852" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Can I apply for winter, spring, or summer quarter admission?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-852">
<p>No, applications will be submitted during autumn quarter for matriculation in the following autumn quarter/in the following academic year (e.g. apply in autumn 2014 for matriculation in autumn of 2015).</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-854" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-854" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Can I apply to more than one department, center or program at Stanford University?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-854">
<p>You may apply to only one degree program per academic year; however, you may only apply concurrently to one departmental program and to a professional school program (law, medicine or business). Please refer to <a href="https://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/faq-applying" title="https://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/faq-applying">https://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/faq-applying</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-4 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-856" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-856" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Can my application to the PhD program be considered for the MA program if my PhD application is not successful?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-856">
<p>Although requesting department evaluation for MA if not accepted to PhD is an option provided in the University Graduate Application, the Department of Anthropology does not offer this option. Students should apply separately to either the PhD or the MA degree program in Anthropology. The department reserves the right to offer admission to an applicant for the MA or PhD regardless of the desired program stated in the Graduate Application.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-5 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-858" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-858" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Is there an application fee? If so how much is it?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-858">
<p>Stanford uses an on‐line application. Information regarding the application fee can be found at <a href="https://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/fee" title="https://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/fee">https://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/fee</a>. This allows applicants to save data and work on their application from any computer on multiple occasions. The University Registrar’s <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions">Office of Graduate Admissions</a> will consider a paper application only if the prospective applicant can show extenuating circumstances that prevent internet access. There is an additional cost for the paper application packet.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-6 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-860" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-860" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Can I obtain a fee waiver or fee reimbursement from Stanford University?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-860">
<p>Stanford University offers several fee reduction programs. For additional information on this University policy, please see <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/fee-waiver" title="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/fee-waiver">http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/fee-waiver</a> and <a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/grad-diversity-council/fee-waiver" title="https://sites.stanford.edu/grad-diversity-council/fee-waiver">https://sites.stanford.edu/grad-diversity-council/fee-waiver</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-7 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-862" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-862" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>When is the Department deadline for submission of my electronic application?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-862">
<p>Electronic submission of the graduate application is due via the web-based application by 9 P.M. PST on Tuesday, December 13, 2016.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-8 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-864" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-864" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Should I arrange to visit the campus or meet with the department faculty before submitting my application? </h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-864">
<p>Applicants are welcome to tour the department and to make an appointment to meet with the Student Services Officer.</p>
<p>Those applicants who wish to tour the campus to learn more about the University should contact the Visitor’s Center <a href="http://www.stanford.edu/dept/visitorinfo/tours/" title="http://www.stanford.edu/dept/visitorinfo/tours/">http://www.stanford.edu/dept/visitorinfo/tours/</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-9 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-866" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-866" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>May I send supplemental materials to my electronic application?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-866">
<p>Yes, please upload all application articles directly to the online application.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-10 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-868" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-868" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>May I send in supplemental materials before I submit my online application?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-868">
<p>Please upload all application articles directly to the online application. If you need to send supplemental materials before the application is available, please contact the Student Services Officer directly via email or telephone at <a href="mailto:selleck@stanford.edu" rel="nofollow">selleck@stanford.edu</a> or 650-723-4641.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-11 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-870" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-870" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>I am interested in applying for a FLAS, Fulbright or NSF fellowship at the time I submit by application to the graduate program. How can I find out more about these extramural funding opportunities?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-870">
<p>For information about extramural funding opportunities, go to the Department of Anthropology’s web page for <a href="https://web.stanford.edu/dept/anthropology/cgi-bin/web/?q=node/13">Funding Opportunities for Graduate Training</a>. Beyond that you may contact the Student Services Officer directly via email or telephone at <a href="mailto:selleck@stanford.edu" rel="nofollow">selleck@stanford.edu</a> or 650-723-4641.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-12 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-872" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-872" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>What is the Graduate Admission policy on representation and authenticity?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-872">
<p>The department’s offer of admission is based on the student’s representation of accurate information in the graduate application. A degree program listed in process and pending completion must be completed as listed in the graduate application. The Registrar office of Graduate Admission policy on representation and authenticity is listed at the Stanford Right of Verification policy located at <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/verification" title="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/verification">http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/verification</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-13 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-874" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-874" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>I submitted my application by the deadline, but it still says “incomplete” on the web-based checklist.  When and how will I be notified if my application is complete?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-874">
<p>The graduate application Checklist is updated by the Department staff from mid-December through mid-January. Keeping in mind that the University is structured on the Quarter system and that there is a University Winter Closure from the third week of December through the first day of classes in January, the checklists may not be completed by staff until mid-January. If the checklist status is ‘incomplete’, it may be that the applicant materials have been received, or not, and the staff have not yet had the opportunity to enter the updated information. Alternately, if certain application materials have not yet been received (i.e. official transcripts, letters of recommendation, and test scores), there should be sufficient time for the applicant to provide these materials during the first part of January.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-14 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-876" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-876" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Who evaluates my graduate application, and what is the process of evaluation?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-876">
<p>Applications are reviewed holistically to assess their promise for teaching and research careers. Greater emphasis may be placed on the statement of purpose and letters of recommendation. Faculty from the Department of Anthropology represent the department’s Graduate Admissions Committee each year – usually about six faculty, with two faculty from each of the department tracks.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-15 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-878" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-878" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>How long is the evaluation process and when can I expect to receive information on the status of my graduate application to the Department of Anthropology? How will I be notified? </h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-878">
<p>Decisions and notifications are usually made by mid-March and sent electronically via email. Please do not call the Department of Anthropology to inquire about the status of your application. The application status for materials received can be checked via the applicant’s web-based account.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-16 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-880" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-880" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>How selective is the admissions process?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-880">
<p>Each year, the Department of Anthropology receives many competitive applications to the PhD program for very few funded openings. As with the PhD program, the Department also receives many competitive applications to the MA program for very few non-funded openings.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-17 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-882" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-882" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>If I am not offered admission to the graduate program in Anthropology, may I reapply? </h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-882">
<p>You may (re)apply to a particular degree program in a subsequent application season. Regardless of a first-time application or a (re) application, the prospective applicant is required to submit an on-line application by the published deadline and pay the application fee for each application submitted.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-18 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-884" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-884" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>If I receive a rejection letter, may I ask the department for more information regarding the department’s decision process and their evaluation of my application?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-884">
<p>The Department is not able to provide specific information related to individual applications. The admissions decisions have been based on an assessment of the qualifications of the applicant relative to the unique applicant pool in a given admissions season.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-19 views-row-odd views-row-last">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-886" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-886" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Is it possible to defer admission into the graduate program in Anthropology if there is a circumstance in which I am unable to begin the graduate program in the following autumn quarter?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-886">
<p>No, the Department does not allow deferral of admission.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div><div id="block-views-stanford-media-media" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-media view-id-stanford_media view-display-id-media view-dom-id-f93b25bebc5c416725406ea61c301d60">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>

</ul></li>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> FAQ for Materials Needed for Application (Application and Supplemental Articles, Required and Optional) </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-916" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/admission/faq/faq-materials-needed-application-application-and-supplemental" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="FAQ for Materials Needed for Application (Application and Supplemental Articles, Required and Optional)" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-911a1db5f735c0a6c57690447b3cfc30" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-show-hide-faq-hierarchy view-id-stanford_show_hide_faq_hierarchy view-display-id-grouping_no_title_block view-dom-id-90bc3ed3d87568d34944c1571682c959">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <h3>Application Material</h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-820" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-820" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Do I need to take the GRE?  And when should I take the GRE?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-820">
<p>Yes, the GRE is required by Stanford University and it is a University-wide requirement for admission. If you would like any further information on GRE scores and Graduate Admissions at Stanford, please go to the University Registrar’s Office of Graduate Admissions web pages located at <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/faq-gre-toefl" title="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/faq-gre-toefl">http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/faq-gre-toefl</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-822" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-822" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Am I required to take GRE subject tests? If so, which ones? And when?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-822">
<p>The Department’s requirement for the GRE test score is for the General Test, only. Verbal, quantitative and analytical writing scores are required of all graduate applicants. No additional subject tests are required.<br /><br />
	Beginning August 1, 2011 ETS launched the revised general test. As ETS states, if you take the GRE Revised General Test in August through September then Stanford will receive the scores by mid-November. We strongly advise you to take the GRE no later than September, so that your scores will be received by the application deadline. Scores must be from an examination taken within the last five years.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-824" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-824" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>What is the required or suggested score range for the GRE necessary to be competitive? </h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-824">
<p>The Department of Anthropology does not state a minimum score, average or range, for the GRE test. There are no statistical averages kept either by the Department or by the University. The GRE test and the significance of the scores are considered by the faculty members who make up the Graduate Admissions Committee on a case by case basis. There is no set standard for evaluation of these scores by the committee. Scores are reviewed holistically, in the context of the applicant's entire file.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-4 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-826" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-826" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Is there an additional or separate process to apply for department funding or for financial aid?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-826">
<p>No, the graduate application for admission to the PhD degree program includes the request for Department funding if accepted to the degree program. There is no funding available to terminal MA students.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-5 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-828" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-828" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>I am taking the GRE in November and my score will not be reported until after the deadline?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-828">
<p>GRE score availability depends on when the exam was taken. Please see the GRE Test Score Schedule to find out when the scores will be available. If scores are received after submission of the application, please email the self-reported scores to <a href="mailto:anth_gradadmission@stanford.edu" rel="nofollow">anth_gradadmission@stanford.edu</a>. Although the Department of Anthropology cannot make a guarantee, an effort will be made by the Department to add the self-reported scores to the application.<br /><br />
	Both the GRE and TOEFL (if required) test scores must be received by the Department of Anthropology’s annual graduate admissions deadline in consideration for graduate admission to the MA or PhD degree programs. In order to ensure timely receipt of the test scores, applicants are encouraged to take the required examination(s) by the end of September prior to the published graduate admissions deadline. The GRE test scores must be provided by way of an examination taken within the past five years from the date of the published graduate admissions deadline. TOEFL test scores must be provided by way of an examination taken within the past eighteen months from the date of the published graduate admissions deadline.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-6 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-830" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-830" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>I am an International applicant who speaks and reads English.  Do I need to take the TOEFL?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-830">
<p>The TOEFL test score(s), either computer based or paper-based, are required for all applicants to the Terminal MA and PhD degree programs whose first language is not English. Exceptions are granted for applicants who have earned a U.S. bachelor’s or master’s degree from a college or university accredited by a regional accrediting association in the United States, or the equivalent degree from a non-U.S. college or university of recognized standing where all instruction is provided in English. This exception does not apply if the courses were completed in a country where English is spoken but not all courses were provided in English. Holding U.S. citizenship does not automatically exempt an applicant from the requirement for the TOEFL; if the applicant’s first language is not English, the applicant must meet the exception above or submit TOEFL scores. TOEFL test scores must be submitted from a test taken within the last eighteen months. Applicants may request confirmation of an exemption by sending an email message to Graduate Admissions at the Stanford University, Registrar at <a href="mailto:gradadmissions@standford.edu" rel="nofollow">gradadmissions@standford.edu</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-7 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-832" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-832" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>How do I send my test scores (TOEFL and GRE) to the department?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-832">
<p>The ETS code for Stanford University is 4704. There is no additional or other Department code. Test scores are sent directly to the Stanford University Office of the Registrar via electronic format. ETS transfers these scores at some time between 1 June and the published graduate admissions deadline of a given graduate admissions year. Please go to <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/exams" title="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/exams">http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/exams</a> for additional information regarding test scores and ETS.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-8 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-834" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-834" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Which of my transcripts am I required to include with my graduate application either by .pdf file upload or by paper copy mailing or delivery?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-834">
<p>The electronic application requires both scanned (.pdf) uploaded copies and original paper (hard) copies of the transcripts from each postsecondary institution attended for one or more years as a full-time student (Summer transcripts are not required). Please go to <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/transcripts" title="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/transcripts">http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/transcripts</a> for additional information regarding transcripts. The .pdf copy is uploaded directly to the electronic application. The copies of the transcript should be official. The official paper copy should be sent directly to the Department of Anthropology. Any other supplemental articles should be uploaded directly to the electronic application. The mailing address for the paper copy transcripts is as follows:</p>
<p>Department of Anthropology<br />
	Graduate Admissions<br />
	Building 50, Main Quad, Room 51G<br />
	450 Serra Mall<br />
	Stanford University<br />
	Stanford, CA 94305-2034.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-9 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-836" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-836" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Are there guidelines for the Statement of Purpose?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-836">
<p>The Statement of Purpose is an important part of application. The graduate admissions committee is primarily concerned with information regarding the applicant’s stated research interests. Applicants should describe in the statement of purpose the following information:<br />
	- reason for applying to the proposed graduate program at Stanford University<br />
	- preparation for the field of study, research and study interests<br />
	- future career plans and other aspects including background and interests which may aid the graduate admission committee in evaluating applicant aptitude and motivation for graduate study<br /><br />
	Generally, a shorter Statement of Purpose, clearly written, is better than a longer statement. Applicants should upload one file that does not exceed 5MB. The Statement of Purpose should be a 900-1,350 word paper. Applicant computers should be set to Western European or other English-language setting.<br /><br />
	Please include the following statement with the statement of purpose upload: ‘In keeping with the spirit of Stanford University's student honor code, I certify that the uploaded Statement of Purpose represents my own work, excepting normal input from advisors and named co authors or sources’.<br /><br />
	Do not send the statement of purpose or other materials via mail or courier to the Department of Anthropology. Applicants who encounter difficulty with uploading the writing sample may send it via pdf email file attachment to the Department of Anthropology at <a href="mailto:anth_gradadmission@stanford.edu" rel="nofollow">anth_gradadmission@stanford.edu</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-10 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-838" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-838" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>What kind of Writing Sample should I submit with my application?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-838">
<p>An appropriate writing sample is comparable to an applicant’s Senior Paper, Honors or Master's Thesis, a published paper, or a comparable written work giving evidence of both writing ability and the capacity for research, analysis, and original thought at the graduate level, demonstrating the ability to use theory in relation to evidence. A short, effectively written sample is preferable to a longer sample. Papers originally written in a language other than English must be submitted in English translation.<br /><br />
	Applicants should upload one file not exceeding 5MB. The writing sample should be a 4,500-5,400 word paper. Applicant computers should be set to Western European or other English-language setting.<br /><br />
	Please include the following statement with the writing sample upload: ‘In keeping with the spirit of Stanford University's student honor code, I certify that the uploaded Writing Sample represents my own work, excepting normal input from advisors and named co authors or sources’. Do not send the writing sample via mail or courier to the Department of Anthropology. Applicants who encounter difficulty with uploading the writing sample may send it via pdf email file attachment to the Department of Anthropology at <a href="mailto:anth_gradadmission@stanford.edu" rel="nofollow">anth_gradadmission@stanford.edu</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-11 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-840" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-840" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>How can I confirm receipt of official GRE test scores and paper copy transcripts?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-840">
<p>Given the number of graduate applications each year, the department is not able to confirm receipt of application articles (inclusive of the paper copy official transcripts) to each graduate applicant. However, the department utilizes the graduate applicant checklist to communicate the completion status of this requirement.<br /><br />
	Regarding the GRE test scores, these scores are received as electronic feed by the University registrar. Once the feed is received, the registrar associates each score with the graduate applicant file, incrementally, from the time of submission of the application.<br /><br />
	Please use the graduate application checklist associated with your CollegeNet registration. Your application status will be updated by the department after the published application deadline and through the end of January (as application articles are received).</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-12 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-842" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-842" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>May I send more than the required number of letters of recommendation? Will this enhance my chances of being offered admission?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-842">
<p>Three letters of recommendation are required, only. It is not the quantity of letters, rather it is the quality of the letters that supports the graduate application. Although, the electronic application will allow an applicant to submit more than three recommenders, please submit three recommenders, only. At least one recommender should be a faculty member at the last school you attended as a full-time student (unless you have been out of school for more than five years). Substitutions for faculty recommenders may include work associates or others who can comment on the applicant’s academic potential for graduate work. By special permission, a substitute or fourth recommender may be added by the applicant, please contact the Student Services Officer directly via email or telephone at <a href="mailto:selleck@stanford.edu" rel="nofollow">selleck@stanford.edu</a> or 650-723-4641 in order to make arrangements for a substitute or fourth referee.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-13 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-844" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-844" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>How are letters of recommendation submitted for the Graduate Application?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-844">
<p>Letters must be submitted using the electronic application. As part of the online application, the applicant will be required to register the names and contact information, including e-mail addresses, of each recommender. Recommenders will then receive an e-mail with directions on how to proceed. For additional information, please go to <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/recommendations" title="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/recommendations">http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/applying/recommendations</a>.  Letters must be received by the published deadline. It is the applicant's responsibility to ensure that letters are submitted to the electronic application by the published deadline.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-14 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-846" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-846" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>How does my recommender upload my letter of recommendation to the graduate application?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-846">
<p>The electronic application and web-based recommendation submission process does not accommodate applicant recommendation via a letter service (i.e. Interfolio or other service). Letters of recommendation are submitted online, by the recommender. The recommender’s email address is used as the contact. Once the recommender’s email address has been provided in the electronic application, an email message is sent to the recommender with instructions on setting up the recommender account and submitting the recommendation, electronically.<br /><br />
	The process of making a recommendation includes submissions of an electronic form in which the recommender answers questions about the qualifications of the application (i.e. how long the recommender has been teaching and the approximate number of students the recommender has taught), and ranking the recommender gives to the applicant compared to all others taught at that level. Due to the electronic application recommendation process, a letter service is not applicable and would not function. Applicants should contact their recommenders notifying them in advance that they will be receiving an email message asking them to submit a letter of recommendation.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-15 views-row-odd views-row-last">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-848" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-848" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>My recommender is unable to upload the form and letter of recommendation online.  Can it be faxed or mailed to the department?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-848">
<p>Letters cannot be emailed or faxed; they will be rejected. If the recommender has difficulty with the electronic application and the requirements for submission of the letter(s) of recommendation, please contact the Student Services Officer directly via email or telephone at <a href="mailto:selleck@stanford.edu" rel="nofollow">selleck@stanford.edu</a> or 650-723-4641 in order to make other arrangements to submit the letter.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div><div id="block-views-stanford-media-media" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-media view-id-stanford_media view-display-id-media view-dom-id-89204281d8ec0cedbe9d9f8ff8e4e3a3">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div><div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-7701f9a6f1cb1335ac602ae099648d67">
