                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Graduate Degree Programs: MA and PhD  </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-135" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/admission/graduate-degree-programs-ma-and-phd" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Graduate Degree Programs: MA and PhD " class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h3>Apply</h3>
<p>To apply to graduate degree programs in the Department of Anthropology, please go to the University Registrar, Graduate Admissions web page located at <a href="http://gradadmissions.stanford.edu/applying">http://gradadmissions.stanford.edu/applying</a>.</p>
<p>For Additional Information about applying to Stanford University, go to:</p>
<ul><li><a href="http://gradadmissions.stanford.edu/">Stanford University Registrar Office of Graduate Admissions</a> for information about graduate admission. Please review the <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions/faq">FAQ</a> provided by the Registrar.</li>
	<li><a href="http://bulletin.stanford.edu/">Stanford University Bulletin</a> for information about university requirements, degree program requirements and course offerings.</li>
	<li>Anthropology Graduate Degrees Program Flyer for information about the department’s graduate degree programs. See the latest copy of Anthropology Graduate Degree Program Flyer on the <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references">Forms and Documents</a> page or refer to the Quick Links section on this page.</li>
	<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-program/admission/faq/faq-anthropology-graduate-program" rel="nofollow">Department of Anthropology Graduate Admission FAQ</a> for information about the department's graduate admission process, programs, and application</li>
</ul><h3>Application Deadline: Tuesday, December 5, 2017</h3>
<p>The graduate application submission deadline for the 2017-2018 academic year is Tuesday, December 5, 2017 at 9:00pm (PST). The application must be submitted and all required supporting documents, including official transcript(s), letters of recommendation, and ETS official GRE/TOFEL scores, must be received by the published deadline. Incomplete applications may not be considered.</p>
<h3>Department Application Requirements</h3>
<ol><li>Submission of the Stanford University Electronic <a href="http://gradadmissions.stanford.edu/">Graduate Admissions Application</a> (for PhD and terminal MA applications only) by the published deadline. Please review the information and instructions, for accessing the electronic application, via the Stanford University Graduate Admissions webpages located at <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions">http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions</a>. To choose an Anthropology graduate degree program, search for the Department of Anthropology in the School of Humanities and Sciences.</li>
	<li>Submission of the Writing Sample detailing evidence of both writing ability, the capacity for research, analysis, original thought at the graduate level, and demonstration of the ability to use theory in relation to evidence. Please submit a 4,500-5,400 word paper, via electronic pdf file upload directly to the electronic graduate application. If electronic submission is not possible, please send an email message to <a href="https://web.stanford.edu/dept/anthropology/cgi-bin/web/anth_gradadmission@stanford.edu">anth_gradadmission@stanford.edu</a> explaining the circumstance and make a request for an alternate method of electronic submission.</li>
	<li>Submission of all cited transcripts, via electronic .pdf file upload directly to the electronic graduate application. In addition to uploading a scanned copy of the transcript, applicants must arrange to have two official transcripts sent from every post-secondary institution attended, for at least one academic year, as a full-time student. NOTE: An official transcript is one that is received directly from the issuing institution that bears the official seal and signature of the institution, representing its validity. See <a href="https://gradadmissions.stanford.edu/applying/starting-your-application/required-application-documents/transcripts-academic-records-0">https://gradadmissions.stanford.edu/applying/starting-your-application/required-application-documents/transcripts-academic-records-0</a>.</li>
	<li>Submission of required test scores by way of the Educational Testing Service (ETS) listing the Stanford University Institutional code: 4704 (there is no department or school code, only the University code)
		<ul><li>GRE General test is required for all national and foreign national applicants. There is no requirement for a specific GRE Subject test.</li>
			<li>TOEFL for all foreign national applicants (please see the information listed at University <a href="https://gradadmissions.stanford.edu/applying/frequently-asked-questions">Registrar Office of Graduate Admissions</a> for exceptions)</li>
		</ul></li>
	<li>Submission of a statement of purpose detailing academic and professional preparation for the Anthropology graduate degree program. Please submit a 900-1,350 word paper, via electronic pdf file upload directly to the electronic graduate application.</li>
	<li>Submission of three letters of recommendation, only. Please review the University Registrar Office of Graduate Admissions instructions for submission of the letters of recommendation. Important - Letters must be submitted electronically by each recommender. <strong>A private letter/credentialing service is not permitted</strong>. If electronic submission is not possible, please send an email message to <a href="mailto:anth_gradadmission@stanford.edu" rel="nofollow">anth_gradadmission@stanford.edu</a> explaining the circumstance and with a request for alternate method of electronic submission. All letters should be received by the published deadline. It is the applicant’s responsibility to communicate with each recommender to ensure that the department’s deadline for submission of the electronic graduate application will be met.</li>
</ol><h3>Requesting Department Evaluation for MA Degree if not admitted to the PhD Degree Program</h3>
<p>Although requesting department evaluation for MA if not accepted to PhD is an option provided in the University Graduate Application, the Department of Anthropology does not offer this option. Students should apply separately to either the PhD or the MA degree program in Anthropology. The department reserves the right to offer admission to an applicant for the MA or PhD regardless of the desired program stated in the Graduate Application.</p>
<h3>Status Information</h3>
<p>Check the status of an application (e.g. letters of recommendation received, official ETS test scores, etc.) by logging into the application account Activity Log. Each graduate admission season decision status information will be available by early March. The selection of Ph.D. students admitted to the Department of Anthropology is based on an individualized, holistic review of each application, including (but not limited to) the applicant's academic record, the letters of recommendation, the scores on both the General GRE (Graduate Record Examination) and the GRE Subject test, the statement of purpose, personal qualities and characteristics, and past accomplishments.</p>
<h3>Process Information</h3>
<p>The selection of PhD students admitted to the Department of Anthropology is based on an individualized, holistic review of each application, including (but, not limited to) the applicant's academic record, the letters of recommendation, the scores on the General GRE (Graduate Record Examination), the statement of purpose, personal qualities and characteristics, and past accomplishments.</p>
<h3>Special Programs at Stanford University</h3>
<h4>Knight-Hennessy Scholars Program</h4>
<p>The <a href="https://knight-hennessy.stanford.edu/">Knight-Hennessy Scholars</a> program is designed to build a multidisciplinary community of Stanford graduate students dedicated to finding creative solutions to the world's greatest challenges.<em> Each year, t</em>his University-endowed Scholars Program awards up to 100 high-achieving Graduate students with  funding to pursue a Graduate education at Stanford. To be considered for admission to the Department of Anthropology MA or PhD degree program as a Knight-Hennessy Scholar, one must apply to Knight-Hennessy Scholars via <a href="https://knight-hennessy.stanford.edu/admission/apply-now">https://knight-hennessy.stanford.edu/admission/apply-now</a> by September 27, 2017; and, apply to Stanford University, Department of Anthropology, Graduate degree program via<a href="https://gradadmissions.stanford.edu/applying"> https://gradadmissions.stanford.edu/applying</a>.  Although, the Department of Anthropology published deadline for submission of the Graduate application is December 5, 2017, only those applicants who have submitted a Knight-Hennessy Scholar application by September 27, 2017; and, who have also submitted a Graduate application to the Department of Anthropology on or by November 15, 2017 are eligible for consideration of graduate admission status to the MA or PhD in Anthropology as a Knight Hennessy Scholar.</p>
<h4>Medical Scientist Training Program</h4>
<p>MSTP application in conjunction with social science PhD programs is only permitted for current Stanford MD students previously admitted to a social science PhD program, through their PhD application process.</p>
<p>Stanford MD students admitted to a Social Science PhD Program may apply for MSTP funding through the <a href="http://med.stanford.edu/mstp/admissions/internaladmissions.html">MSTP internal admissions process.</a> For more information, please go to http://med.stanford.edu/mstp/admissions.html</p>
<h3>Contact Information</h3>
<p><em><span>University Registrar Office of Graduate Admissions Contact Information:</span></em><br />
	Web page: <a href="https://gradadmissions.stanford.edu">https://gradadmissions.stanford.edu</a><br />
	E-mail: <a href="mailto:%20gradadmissions@stanford.edu" rel="nofollow">gradadmissions@stanford.edu</a></p>
<p><em><span>Department of Anthropology Contact Information:</span></em><br />
	Web page: <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.ed" rel="nofollow">https://anthropology.stanford.edu</a><br />
	E-mail: <a href="mailto:%20anth_gradadmission@stanford.edu" rel="nofollow">anth_gradadmission@stanford.edu</a></p>
<p><em>Mailing Address:</em><br />
	Department of Anthropology<br />
	450 Serra Mall, Main Quadrangle, Building 50, Room 51G<br />
	Stanford, CA 94305-2034</p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>

<meta name="description" content="The Coterminal M.A. degree program allows Stanford undergraduates to study for a master’s degree while completing their bachelor’s degree(s) in the same or a different department. Undergraduates with strong academic records may apply for admission to a coterminal master’s program upon completion of 120 units, but no later than the quarter prior to the expected completion of the undergraduate degree. Full-time enrollment during Summer Quarters, as well as allowable undergraduate transfer credit, are also counted towards quarters of undergraduate study." />

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Coterminal MA </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-93" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/admissions/coterminal" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Coterminal MA" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>The Coterminal M.A. degree program allows Stanford undergraduates to study for a master’s degree while completing their bachelor’s degree(s) in the same or a different department. Undergraduates with strong academic records may apply for admission to a coterminal master’s program upon completion of 120 units, but no later than the quarter prior to the expected completion of the undergraduate degree. Full-time enrollment during Summer Quarters, as well as allowable undergraduate transfer credit, are also counted towards quarters of undergraduate study. Students who wish to apply for a master’s program after these deadlines must apply through the regular graduate admissions process. For the terminal M.A. degree program please see <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-programs/admissions/doctoral-terminal-program">Admissions - Doctor of Philosophy and Terminal Master of Arts</a>.</p>
<p>The deadline for graduate applications to the Coterminal M.A. degree program is December 13, 2016. Stanford University undergraduate majors are eligible to apply for the coterminal master’s degree program with a 3.5 GPA in their department major, a 3.0 GPA in overall course work, and with no more than one incomplete listed on the transcript at the time of application. Please note that Coterminal master's degree applicants are not required to submit their Graduate Record Examination scores.</p>
<p>Prospective applicants should see <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/cotermdegrees/#text">http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/cotermdegrees/#text</a> for the application forms and further information about the application process.</p>
<h3>Department Application Requirements</h3>
<p>Applicants must submit the following:</p>
<ol><li><a href="https://www.applyweb.com/stanterm/" target="_blank">Online Application</a> for Admission to Coterminal Master’s Program. Link to Coterm online application: <a href="https://www.applyweb.com/stanterm/" target="_blank">https://www.applyweb.com/stanterm/</a>.</li>
<li>Preliminary Program Proposal, Coterminal Degree Program</li>
<li>Coterminal Course Approval Form</li>
<li>Two Letters of Recommendation</li>
<li>All relevant transcripts</li>
<li>A 2-3 page, singled-spaced Statement of Purpose<br /><ol style="list-style-type:lower-alpha"><li>The statement of purpose should describe succinctly your reasons for applying to the proposed program at Stanford, your preparation for this field of study, study and research interests, future career plans, and other aspects of your background and interests which may aid the admissions committee in evaluating your aptitude and motivation for graduate study.</li>
<li>For tips on writing Statement of Purpose and Personal Statement Essays, please see <a href="https://gradadmissions.stanford.edu/applying/starting-your-application/required-application-documents/statement-purpose" title="https://gradadmissions.stanford.edu/applying/starting-your-application/required-application-documents/statement-purpose">https://gradadmissions.stanford.edu/applying/starting-your-application/r...</a></li>
</ol></li>
<li>Writing Sample in English: A 10-12 page paper giving evidence of both writing ability and the capacity for research, analysis, and original thought at the graduate level, and demonstrating the ability to use theory in relation to evidence. If your writing sample is longer than 10-12 pages, please indicate which 10-12 pages should be reviewed by the admissions committee.</li>
</ol><p>Application must be submitted with all required supporting documents by the published deadline. Incomplete applications may not be considered.</p>
<p style="color: red">M.A. Application Deadline: Tuesday, December 13, 2016</p>
<p>It is highly suggested by this department that a student, who accepts an offer of admission to the ANTHRO Coterminal Master's program, defers their Undergraduate B.A. conferral until the Graduate M.A degree requirements have been completed. The student can then request to graduate in both the B.A. and M.A. simultaneously. Please see the Student Services Officer for details.</p>
<p>Please contact the Undergraduate Student Services Officer if you have any questions regarding the status of your application to the Coterminal M.A. degree program in the Department of Anthropology.</p>
<h3>Decision and Acceptances</h3>
<p>Applicants will be notified of their admissions decision prior to Spring quarter of their senior year.</p>
<h3>Department Policies</h3>
<p>For Department policy pertaining to Coterm Course Transfer and Registrar Coterm web page, see <a href="https://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/registrar/students/coterm" target="_blank">https://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/registrar/students/coterm</a>.</p>
<h3>Contact Information</h3>
<p><i>University Registrar office of Graduate Admissions Contact Information:</i><br />
	Web page: <a href="http://gradadmissions.stanford.edu" title="http://gradadmissions.stanford.edu">http://gradadmissions.stanford.edu</a><br />
	Email: <a href="mailto:gradadmissions@stanford.edu">gradadmissions@stanford.edu</a></p>
<p><i>Department of Anthropology Contact Information:</i><br />
	Undergraduate Student Services Officer<br />
	Anahid Sarkissian<br />
	E-mail: <a href="mailto:%20anahids@stanford.edu">anahids@stanford.edu</a></p>
<p>Department of Anthropology<br />
        Graduate Admissions Committee<br />
        450 Serra Mall, Main Quadrangle<br />
        Building 50, Room 51N<br />
        Stanford, CA 94305-2034</p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span6">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Anthropology Graduate Student Organization </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-1086" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/anthropology-graduate-student-organization" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Anthropology Graduate Student Organization" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h2>About the GSO</h2>
<p>The Anthropology Graduate Student Organization advocates for graduate students within Stanford’s Anthropology department and the university as a whole. It serves as a liaison between the department’s students, faculty, and staff; forms a sounding board for issues of collective concern; connects students with appropriate university resources; and coordinates other student-driven actions.</p>
<p>The GSO’s responsibilities include:</p>
<ul><li>Holding quarterly student meetings;</li>
<li>Organizing the annual student-faculty town hall;</li>
<li>Coordinating student-led activities and workshops;</li>
<li>Attending monthly faculty meetings and distributing notes to students;</li>
<li>Contributing to the campus visit weekend for accepted students;</li>
<li>Connecting first-year students with department life through mentoring and social events;</li>
<li>Maintaining the GSO email listserv and other communications.</li>
</ul><h2>Participation</h2>
<p><i>All anthropology graduate students are automatically members of the GSO, which is the primary means by which students keep themselves informed of, and participate in, department decision making and activities. </i> Students are expected to participate regularly in the GSO’s quarterly meetings, annual town hall, and other events.</p>
<p> </p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-655345625546a75a3e297cb16d805c88">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div><div id="block-views-stanford-media-media" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-media view-id-stanford_media view-display-id-media view-dom-id-ab9459e1ea56c63ef1f7272abbb5f6ad">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
 </div>
                                  </div>
          <!-- /#content-wrap -->
        </div>
        <!-- /#content -->
                <div id="sidebar-second" class="sidebar site-sidebar-second span3">
          <div class="row-fluid"><div class="region region-sidebar-second clearfix">
  <div id="block-block-16" class="clearfix block block-block gso-contact anthro-sidebar border-simple-nowidth border-shadow descriptor">     <h2>Contact the GSO</h2>
      <div class="content"> <p><strong><em>Have an idea, problem, or question? </em></strong>Get in touch with the representatives by sending an email to <a href="mailto:anthrogso@gmail.com">anthrogso@gmail.<br />com</a>.</p>
<p>	Sensitive or individual concerns can also be raised directly with a representative from the appropriate track.</p>
 </div>
</div>
<div id="block-block-18" class="clearfix block block-block gso-contact anthro-sidebar border-simple-nowidth border-shadow descriptor">     <h2>GSO Handbook</h2>
      <div class="content"> <p>For more details about the GSO’s responsibilities and structure, download the current <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/gso_rep_handbook.pdf" target="_blank">GSO Handbook</a>.</p>
 </div>
</div>
</div>

<meta name="description" content="Graduate Learning Outcomes The Ph.D. is conferred upon candidates who have demonstrated substantial scholarship and the ability to conduct independent research and analysis in Anthropology. Through completion of advanced course work and rigorous skills training, the Doctoral degree program prepares students to make original contributions to the knowledge of Anthropology and to interpret and present the results of such research. Students may pursue two different tracks in the Anthropology Ph.D. degree program:" />

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Doctoral Program </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-129" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/doctoral-program" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Doctoral Program" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-image group_s_postcard_image"><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-info field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-large-scaled field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/322" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="border-simple-nowidth border-shadow"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/large-scaled/public/outdoor_classroom_0.png?itok=TpCyE2pM" width="270" height="180" alt="Students holding class outdoors" /></div></div></div></div><div class="caption"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-caption field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Students meet for their course section outdoors on a nice day.</p>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h3 name="text">Graduate Learning Outcomes</h3>
<p>The Ph.D. is conferred upon candidates who have demonstrated substantial scholarship and the ability to conduct independent research and analysis in Anthropology. Through completion of advanced course work and rigorous skills training, the Doctoral degree program prepares students to make original contributions to the knowledge of Anthropology and to interpret and present the results of such research.</p>
<p>Students may pursue two different tracks in the Anthropology Ph.D. degree program:</p>
<ol><li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-program/graduate-program-tracks#arch">Archaeology;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-program/graduate-program-tracks#cs">Culture and Society </a></li>
</ol><p>The Ph.D. program allows the student to develop a flexible program reflecting special research interests, under the supervision of a faculty committee chosen by the student. Students are encouraged to plan for completion of all work for the Ph.D. in five years.</p>
<p>Ph.D. students in Anthropology must complete a minimum of 135 quarter units with a minimum grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 (B). The maximum allowable number of transfer units is 45.</p>
<p>Download the Department of Anthropology Graduate Program Flyer and the Department of Anthropology Graduate Handbook for information concerning the Anthropology Graduate degree programs. These references can be found on the  <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references">Graduate Forms and References page</a>.</p>
<p>For more detailed description of the Anthropology Master of Arts Program, see Department of Anthropology <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-programs/about/master-program">About the Master of Arts Program</a> and the <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofhumanitiesandsciences/anthropology/#masterstext">Stanford University Bulletin Explore Degrees </a>.</p>
<p>For more detailed description of the Anthropology Doctor of Philosophy Program, see Department of Anthropology <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-programs/about/doctoral-program">About the Doctor of Philosophy Program</a> and the <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofhumanitiesandsciences/anthropology/#doctoraltext">Stanford University Bulletin Explore Degrees</a>.</p>
<p> </p>
<p> </p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>

  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-d8d6e1c4353c9142db2b3662d174c918">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div><div id="block-views-stanford-media-media" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-media view-id-stanford_media view-display-id-media view-dom-id-4885c64023350bc75082f08e6b01ee1d">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> FAQ for Anthropology Graduate Program  </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-914" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/admission/faq/faq-anthropology-graduate-program" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="FAQ for Anthropology Graduate Program " class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-911a1db5f735c0a6c57690447b3cfc30" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-show-hide-faq-hierarchy view-id-stanford_show_hide_faq_hierarchy view-display-id-grouping_no_title_block view-dom-id-d18ec19af8ec23f2227c05a538f63808">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <h3>Graduate Program</h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-770" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-770" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>How long does it take to get a PhD in Anthropology at Stanford?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-770">
<p>The Ph.D. program allows the student to develop a flexible program reflecting special research interests, under the supervision of a faculty committee chosen by the student. Students are encouraged to plan for completion of all work for the Ph.D. in five years.</p>
<p>Ph.D. students in Anthropology must complete a minimum of 135 quarter units with a minimum grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 (B). The maximum allowable number of transfer units is 45.<br />
		The typical time to degree is approximately 6 years, although it is quite possible to complete all the requirements in 5 years. A typical schedule is as follows:</p>
<ul><li>Years 1 and 2 – coursework and teaching assistance,</li>
<li>Year 3 – qualifying exams and research proposal,</li>
<li>Year 4 – approved dissertation research, typically in the field,</li>
<li>Years 5 and 6 – research, analysis, data collection, write-up, teaching assistance and oral examination – Dissertation defense.</li>
<p>For additional information please see the <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofhumanitiesandsciences/anthropology/">Stanford University Bulletin</a>, the <a href="https://www.stanford.edu/dept/anthropology/cgi-bin/web/?q=system/files/1213gradprogram.pdf">Anthropology Graduate Program Flyer</a>, and the <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-programs/about/doctoral-program">department graduate program webpage</a>.</p>
</ul>
<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-772" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-772" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Are there different tracks of specialization within the graduate program in Anthropology?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-772">
<p>Culture and Society and Archaeology are the two tracks of specialization in the doctoral program. Within these tracks, students may explore a range of fields of study including medical anthropology and ecological and environmental anthropology. Examples of the varying <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/people/faculty">faculty</a> and <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/people/students">student</a> areas of study can be found in their respective profiles online. Although, the tracks are informal and at the department-level, only, they are an important way for the department to identify the student’s developing research.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-774" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-774" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>How can I find out about faculty research and faculty contact information?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-774">
<p>The department faculty and their research interests are listed online at <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/people/faculty" target="_blank">Anthropology Faculty</a>. Current PhD students in the Department of Anthropology may be contacted by visiting <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/people/students" target="_blank">Anthropology Graduate Students</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-4 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-776" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-776" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>How can I find out about graduate student research and graduate student contact information?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-776">
<p>Current PhD students in the Department of Anthropology may be contacted by visiting <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/people/students" target="_blank">Anthropology Graduate Students</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-5 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-778" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-778" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>What is the language requirement for the PhD in Anthropology?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-778">
<p>PhD candidates must prove competence in a foreign language by the end of spring quarter of their Second Year. The chosen language may be related to field research or scholarly work.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-6 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-780" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-780" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>What is the teaching requirement for the PhD in Anthropology? </h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-780">
<p>The Department requires one quarter of Teaching Assistantship in the Second Year and at least one quarter of Teaching Assistantship in the Fifth Year. The Department requires students in the Second Year cohort to attend a Teaching Assistantship Training workshop at the beginning of the academic year.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-7 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-782" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-782" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>If I have prior graduate work, can it be transferred into the PhD degree program?  Will this accelerate my doctoral degree program?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-782">
<p>After at least one quarter of enrollment in the first year, students pursuing a PhD may apply for transfer credit for up to 45 units of graduate work done at another institution.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-8 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-784" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-784" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>If I have prior graduate work, can it be transferred into the MA program in Anthropology?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-784">
<p>No, prior graduate work may not be transferred or credited toward the MA degree program.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-9 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-786" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-786" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Does the MA degree program lead into the PhD degree program?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-786">
<p>No, transferring from the MA degree program to the PhD degree program is not usually permitted. Anthropology MA applicants whose ultimate goal is the Anthropology PhD program should apply directly to the PhD degree program.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-10 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-788" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-788" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Do I have to have an MA or other graduate work before I apply to the PhD program?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-788">
<p>No, applicants to the PhD program are not required to have an MA before applying to the PhD program. Less than one third of an entering PhD cohort will have obtained a masters degree.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-11 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-790" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-790" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>My most recent degree is not from an anthropology program. Will this adversely affect my graduate application?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-790">
<p>No, applicants are not required to have an Anthropology background. However, a background in the behavioral/ and or social sciences would be expected. In addition, the applicant would be expected to have a foundation in social science theory and the ability to do analysis in the social sciences.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-12 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-792" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-792" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>How can I obtain more information from the Anthropology Department regarding my interest in graduate studies?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-792">
<p>Please refer to the <a href="http://www.stanford.edu/dept/registrar/bulletin/">University Bulletin</a>, <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions" target="_blank">Department Admissions</a> website, and <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/gradadmissions" target="_blank">Registrars Office of Graduate Admissions</a> website for more information. Contact information for graduate students including a description of their topic and area(s) of interest is also available at the Department website under <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/people/students" target="_blank">Graduate Students</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-13 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-794" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-794" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Is funding offered to PhD students in Anthropology?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-794">
<p>The Department of Anthropology offers five years of graduate funding (based on the availability of funds) for the PhD program, through a combination of fellowships and assistantships, covering full tuition and a living stipend. The fellowships are usually given for five consecutive years of graduate study. In addition to the graduate funding offer, the PhD student is also offered funding for two summers of pre-field summer research; and health insurance coverage during the academic year (autumn, winter and spring quarters).</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-14 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-796" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-796" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Is funding offered to MA students in Anthropology?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-796">
<p>There is no financial support available through the Department of Anthropology to support students in the graduate Masters program. For more information about other funding opportunities, please contact the Student Services Officer directly via email or telephone at <a href="mailto:selleck@stanford.edu" rel="nofollow">selleck@stanford.edu</a> or 650-723-4641.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-15 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-798" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-798" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Is there a difference between department funding support and financial aid?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-798">
<p>Although, departmental funding support is sometimes referred to as ‘Financial Aid’ this funding is distinct from federal or other funding that an individual student may apply for through the <a href="http://www.stanford.edu/dept/finaid/grad/">Financial Aid</a> office of Stanford University. Department funding support for PhD students is funding provided from the School of Humanities and Sciences by way of the Department for the purpose of supporting the PhD student’s living expenses as well academic and research expenses throughout the PhD degree program.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-16 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-800" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-800" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Is Stanford on a quarter or semester system?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-800">
<p>Stanford is on the Quarter System. For more information about Stanford’s schedule, please go to the <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/registrar/academic-calendar">Stanford Academic Calendar</a> published by the Office of the Registrar.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-17 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-802" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-802" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Where can I find out more information about course offerings in Anthropology?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-802">
<p>Information about current Anthropology course offerings can be found on our Department website under <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/node/847" rel="nofollow">Courses</a>. Course listings beyond the current quarter can be viewed in <a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/CourseSearch/search?view=catalog&amp;catalog=&amp;page=0&amp;q=ANTHRO&amp;filter-catalognumber-ANTHRO=on&amp;filt">Stanford Bulletin Explore Courses</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-18 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-804" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-804" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Where can I find information about graduate degrees in Anthropology?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-804">
<p>Information about the department’s Doctoral and Masters degree programs, please review the information located on the <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-program/about">Department web pages</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-19 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-806" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-806" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Where can I find information about graduate housing at Stanford University?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-806">
<p>Information about campus housing for graduate students can be found on <a href="http://www.stanford.edu/dept/rde/shs/index.htm">Stanford’s Student Housing</a> website under <a href="http://www.stanford.edu/dept/rde/shs/grad/pros_students.htm">Prospective Students</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-20 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-808" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-808" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Where can I find information about the estimated cost of living at Stanford University?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-808">
<p>Information about the estimated cost of living at Stanford as a graduate student can be found on <a href="http://www.stanford.edu/dept/finaid/grad/budget/index.html">The Student Budget</a> website. Remember that this is only an estimate, your actual expenses may be different.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-21 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-810" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-810" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Does Stanford offer grant and loan opportunities to graduate students?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-810">
<p>Information about sources of Graduate student funding can be found at <a href="http://vpge.stanford.edu/funding/sources.html" title="http://vpge.stanford.edu/funding/sources.html">http://vpge.stanford.edu/funding/sources.html</a>.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-22 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-812" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-812" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Will admission to the MA program help increase my chances of being admitted to the doctoral degree program?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-812">
<p>Admission to the Master's degree program does not increase the probability of admission to the doctoral degree program. If a current Stanford University MA student applies to the PhD degree program, the applicant will be considered equally with all other graduate applicants.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-23 views-row-odd">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-814" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-814" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>What is the annual cost of attending your program?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-814">
<p>The tuition for the 2015-2016 academic year can be located at <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/registrar/students/tuition-fees_15-16" title="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/registrar/students/tuition-fees_15-16">http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/registrar/students/tuition-fees_15-16</a></p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-24 views-row-even">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-816" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-816" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Is there an additional or separate process to apply for department funding or for financial aid?</h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-816">
<p>The Department of Anthropology usually offers identical five-year funding packages to all admitted PhD students, with two additional summer quarters of funding. Funding is intended to cover the applicable tuition costs, Stanford Cardinal Care health insurance expenses, and various living expenses in the form of direct stipend, teaching assistantships or pre-doctoral research assistantships. The department, with the School of Humanities and Sciences, is also committed to sponsoring students' involvement in professional activities and may reimburse many of the expenses for research travel, summer language study, and participation in academic conferences. Applicants to the graduate PhD degree program in Anthropology do not need to submit an additional application for funding at the time when the graduate application is submitted. The department encourages students in all stages of the PhD degree program to apply for funding from intra and extramural funding sources.</p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-25 views-row-odd views-row-last">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-nothing">        <span class="field-content"><hr></span>  </div>  
  <div>        <div><a aria-controls="faq-collapse0-818" aria-expanded="false" class="collapse-toggle collapsed" href="#faq-collapse0-818" data-toggle="collapse" type="button"><h4>Are there funding opportunities appropriate for application by a graduate applicant before admission to a graduate     program? </h4></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><div class="collapse" id="faq-collapse0-818">
<div>
	<p>Listed below, are just a few of the agencies providing graduate fellowships. Applicants are urged to consult funding references for additional sources of support.</p>
	<p>NSF Graduate Research Fellowship Program <a href="http://www.nsfgrfp.org/" title="http://www.nsfgrfp.org/" rel="nofollow">http://www.nsfgrfp.org/</a></p>
	<p>Ford Minority Predoctoral Fellowship Program <a href="http://sites.nationalacademies.org/PGA/FordFellowships/PGA_047958" title="http://sites.nationalacademies.org/PGA/FordFellowships/PGA_047958" rel="nofollow">http://sites.nationalacademies.org/PGA/FordFellowships/PGA_047958</a></p>
	<p>Mellon Mays Predoctoral Research Grants <a href="http://www.ssrc.org/fellowships/mellon-mays-predoctoral-research-grants/" title="http://www.ssrc.org/fellowships/mellon-mays-predoctoral-research-grants/" rel="nofollow">http://www.ssrc.org/fellowships/mellon-mays-predoctoral-research-grants/</a></p>
	<p>Various Foreign Language and Area Studies grants</p>
</div>
<p> </p>

<span class="edit-link"></span>
</div></div>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>

      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">

<meta name="description" content="This section provides anthropology graduate (and, in some cases undergraduate students) with information to identify and apply for grants and fellowships at a variety of stages during a  graduate academic career. The resources provided below direct students to common grant and fellowship sponsoring organizations at Stanford University (intramural) and at organizations external to Stanford University (extramural) The Department of Anthropology is not responsible for the content or information provided below." />

<li class="expanded menu-mlid-2216 dropdown"><a href="/people/faculty-and-affiliates" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">People <span class="caret"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu"><li class="first leaf has-children menu-mlid-2214"><a href="/people/faculty-and-affiliates" title="">Faculty and Affiliates</a></li>

          <div class="row-fluid"><div class="region region-sidebar-first clearfix">
  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jsa-layouts-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Graduate Program</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jsa_layouts-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-1215"><a href="/graduate-program" title="">Graduate Program Overview</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1239"><a href="/graduate-program/doctoral-program" title="">Doctoral Program</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1245"><a href="/graduate-program/master-degree-program">Master Degree Program</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2822"><a href="/graduate-program/graduate-program-tracks">Tracks within Graduate Program</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1251"><a href="/graduate-program/graduate-admission">Admission</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2109"><a href="https://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;catalog=&amp;page=0&amp;q=ANTHRO&amp;filter-catalognumber-ANTHRO=on&amp;filt" title="menu link directs people to anthropology courses on Stanford Bulletin Explore Courses site">Courses</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-3142"><a href="/graduate-program/anthropology-graduate-student-organization">Graduate Student Organization</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-1255"><a href="/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references" title="">Graduate Forms and References</a></li>
<li class="last expanded active-trail active menu-mlid-1253 dropdown-submenu"><a href="/graduate-program/intra-and-extra-mural-funding" title="" class="active-trail dropdown-toggle active" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Intra- and Extra-Mural Funding</a><ul class="dropdown-menu"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-2113"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-area-studies-and-language-training">Funding Opportunities for Area Studies and Language Training</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2115"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-graduate-training">Funding Opportunities for Graduate Training (includes opportunities for application both pre- and post- graduate admission to a Doctoral degree program)</a></li>

        <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Intra- and Extra-Mural Funding </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-83" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/intra-and-extra-mural-funding" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Intra- and Extra-Mural Funding" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>This section provides anthropology graduate (and, in some cases undergraduate students) with information to identify and apply for grants and fellowships at a variety of stages during a  graduate academic career. The resources provided below direct students to common grant and fellowship sponsoring organizations at Stanford University (intramural) and at organizations external to Stanford University (extramural)</p>
<p>The Department of Anthropology is not responsible for the content or information provided below.</p>
<p><a class="more-link" href="http://med.stanford.edu/rmg/funding/funding_database.html" title="http://med.stanford.edu/rmg/funding/funding_database.html">http://med.stanford.edu/rmg/funding/funding_database.html</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://highwire.stanford.edu/lists/portals.dtl" title="http://highwire.stanford.edu/lists/portals.dtl">http://highwire.stanford.edu/lists/portals.dtl</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://www-sul.stanford.edu/guides/funding.html" title="http://www-sul.stanford.edu/guides/funding.html">http://www-sul.stanford.edu/guides/funding.html</a></p>
<p>Recommended webpage references for proposal and thesis writing (formatting and style) information include the following:<br /><a class="more-link" href="http://www-tcad.stanford.edu/%7Egoojs/RESEARCH/thesis.html" title="http://www-tcad.stanford.edu/~goojs/RESEARCH/thesis.html">http://www-tcad.stanford.edu/~goojs/RESEARCH/thesis.html</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://help-csli.stanford.edu/tex/suthesis" title="http://help-csli.stanford.edu/tex/suthesis">http://help-csli.stanford.edu/tex/suthesis</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://www.aaanet.org/publications/guidelines.cfm" title="http://www.aaanet.org/publications/guidelines.cfm" rel="nofollow">http://www.aaanet.org/publications/guidelines.cfm</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://esapubs.org/esapubs/preparation.htm" title="http://esapubs.org/esapubs/preparation.htm" rel="nofollow">http://esapubs.org/esapubs/preparation.htm</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://www.saa.org/AbouttheSociety/Publications/StyleGuide/tabid/984/Default.aspx" title="http://www.saa.org/AbouttheSociety/Publications/StyleGuide/tabid/984/Default.aspx" rel="nofollow">http://www.saa.org/AbouttheSociety/Publications/StyleGuide/tabid/984/Def...</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://www.press.uchicago.edu/journals/ca/style.html?journal=ca" title="http://www.press.uchicago.edu/journals/ca/style.html?journal=ca" rel="nofollow">http://www.press.uchicago.edu/journals/ca/style.html?journal=ca</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://www.sha.org/publications/for_authors.cfm" title="http://www.sha.org/publications/for_authors.cfm" rel="nofollow">http://www.sha.org/publications/for_authors.cfm</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://www.stanford.edu/%7Ejhj1/grant-advice.html" title="http://www.stanford.edu/~jhj1/grant-advice.html">http://www.stanford.edu/~jhj1/grant-advice.html</a></p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>

  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-c4e75fb9fee00a889c7aa32765b86540">

<meta name="description" content="Available to post-field research graduate students these programs are typically aimed at providing dissertation writers with financial support for one year in order to facilitate the completion of their dissertations. Specific prerequisites vary, but applicants are generally expected to have met all their graduate program requirements, except for submission of their dissertation(&quot;All But Dissertation - ABD&quot;), in order to be eligible for funding." />
