          <div class="row-fluid"><div class="region region-sidebar-first clearfix">
  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jsa-layouts-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Graduate Program</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jsa_layouts-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-1215"><a href="/graduate-program" title="">Graduate Program Overview</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1239"><a href="/graduate-program/doctoral-program" title="">Doctoral Program</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1245"><a href="/graduate-program/master-degree-program">Master Degree Program</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2822"><a href="/graduate-program/graduate-program-tracks">Tracks within Graduate Program</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1251"><a href="/graduate-program/graduate-admission">Admission</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2109"><a href="https://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;catalog=&amp;page=0&amp;q=ANTHRO&amp;filter-catalognumber-ANTHRO=on&amp;filt" title="menu link directs people to anthropology courses on Stanford Bulletin Explore Courses site">Courses</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-3142"><a href="/graduate-program/anthropology-graduate-student-organization">Graduate Student Organization</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-1255"><a href="/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references" title="">Graduate Forms and References</a></li>
<li class="last expanded active-trail menu-mlid-1253 dropdown-submenu"><a href="/graduate-program/intra-and-extra-mural-funding" title="" class="active-trail dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Intra- and Extra-Mural Funding</a><ul class="dropdown-menu"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-2113"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-area-studies-and-language-training">Funding Opportunities for Area Studies and Language Training</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2115"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-graduate-training">Funding Opportunities for Graduate Training (includes opportunities for application both pre- and post- graduate admission to a Doctoral degree program)</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2117"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-dissertation-research">Funding Opportunities for Dissertation Research</a></li>
<li class="last leaf active-trail active menu-mlid-2119"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunites-dissertation-writing-and-completion" title="" class="active-trail active">Funding Opportunities for Dissertation Writing and Completion</a></li>
</ul></li>
</ul></div>
 </div>
</div>
</div>
 <!-- /.region -->
</div>
        </div>
        <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Funding Opportunites for Dissertation Writing and Completion </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-163" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunites-dissertation-writing-and-completion" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Funding Opportunites for Dissertation Writing and Completion" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Available to post-field research graduate students these programs are typically aimed at providing dissertation writers with financial support for one year in order to facilitate the completion of their dissertations. Specific prerequisites vary, but applicants are generally expected to have met all their graduate program requirements, except for submission of their dissertation("All But Dissertation - ABD"), in order to be eligible for funding.</p>
<h3>Off-Campus Grants</h3>
<h4>Andrew W. Mellon Foundation/ACLS Early Career Fellowships</h4>
<p>Website: <a href="https://www.acls.org/programs/dcf/" title="https://www.acls.org/programs/dcf/" rel="nofollow">https://www.acls.org/programs/dcf/</a><br />
	Deadline: mid to late October<br />
	Requirements:</p>
<ul><li>Application form, proposal (5 double-spaced pages), one-page timeline, up to 3 additional pages of images, musical scores or supporting non-text materials;</li>
	<li>Bibliography;</li>
	<li>Completed chapter of the dissertation not more than 25 double-spaced pages;</li>
	<li>Two (2) reference letters; and</li>
	<li>A statement from the applicant’s institution (1) statement attesting to the viability of the proposed timeline for completion, (2) stipulation that, in the event of an award the university will not charge the student or fees beyond the limit of $5,000, and (3) applicant will not be provided with a subsequent aid. The person submitting the institutional statement cannot be one of the reference letter writers.</li>
</ul><hr /><h4>Charlotte W. Newcombe Doctoral Dissertation Fellowship</h4>
<p>Website: <a href="http://woodrow.org/fellowships/newcombe/#about" title="http://woodrow.org/fellowships/newcombe/#about" rel="nofollow">http://woodrow.org/fellowships/newcombe/#about</a><br />
	Deadline: mid November<br />
	Requirements:</p>
<ul><li>Applicants may not apply again,</li>
	<li>Writing on topics where ethical or religious values are a central concern,</li>
	<li>Must expect to complete between April 1, 2016 and August 31, 2016,</li>
	<li>Three (3) letters of recommendations, and</li>
</ul><hr /><h4>The Hanry Frank Gugenheim Foudation, Dissertation Fellowship</h4>
<p>Website: <a href="http://www.hfg.org/df/print.htm" title="http://www.hfg.org/df/print.htm" rel="nofollow">http://www.hfg.org/df/print.htm</a><br />
	Deadline: early February<br />
	Requirements:</p>
<ul><li>Questions that interest the foundation concern violence and aggression in relation to social change, intergroup conflict, war, terrorism, crime, and family relationships, among other subjects. Dissertations with no relevance to understanding human violence and aggression will not be supported,</li>
	<li>Title, abstract, survey questions, advisor’s letter (directly emailed by the advisor, letter is due February 15, 2015), advisor’s cv, applicant’s cv, transcript, project description (15 double-space pages).</li>
</ul><hr /><h4>The Peace Institute, Jennings Randolph Peace Scholar Dissertation Fellowship</h4>
<p>Website: <a href="http://www.usip.org/grants-fellowships/fellowship-opportunities/jennings-randolph-peace-scholarship-dissertation-program" title="http://www.usip.org/grants-fellowships/fellowship-opportunities/jennings-randolph-peace-scholarship-dissertation-program" rel="nofollow">http://www.usip.org/grants-fellowships/fellowship-opportunities/jennings...</a><br />
	Deadline: mid December<br />
	Requirements:</p>
<ul><li>Topics related to international conflict management and peace building,</li>
	<li>Consisted with the Institute’s mission (?) and a research agenda with relevance to the policy issues,</li>
	<li>Three (3) letters of reference,</li>
	<li>Proposal: abstract/summary, significance &amp; objectives, research schedule, products, and likelihood of completion.</li>
</ul><hr /><h4>The Institute of Turkish Studies, The Dissertation Writing Grant</h4>
<p>Website: <a href="http://www.turkishstudies.org/grants/grants_competition.shtml" title="http://www.turkishstudies.org/grants/grants_competition.shtml" rel="nofollow">http://www.turkishstudies.org/grants/grants_competition.shtml</a><br />
	Deadline: early March<br />
	Requirements:</p>
<ul><li>Two-page application cover sheet ,</li>
	<li>Project proposal (max. 6 double-spaced pages) (dissertation tittle, amount of research &amp; writing carried out so far, major thesis &amp; relation to the current literature, location &amp; duration of research, methodology, assessment of originality of the work and the contribution to will make to your field, a short list of primary and secondary sources.,</li>
	<li>Budget, no university overhead costs can be covered, the other sources applied to, if matching university fellowships, it must be stated too. ,</li>
	<li>Three (3) letters of recommendations, hard copy, sealed by the referee, mailed by the applicant inside the application package.,</li>
	<li>A current CV,</li>
	<li>Transcripts of Graduate work ,</li>
	<li>The package to be sent through the UPS to this address:<br />
		      Dr. Sinan Ciddi<br />
		      Institute of Turkish Studies<br />
		      Intercultural Center 305R<br />
		      Georgetown University, 37th &amp; O Street<br />
		      WASHINGTON DC, DC 20057-1033, United States</li>
	<li>Stipends range from $5,000 to $15,000 Note: The Institute supports works in the field of Ottoman and Modern Turkish Studies. It has mostly supported historians but there are a few anthropological projects supported as well.</li>
</ul><hr /><h3>On-Campus Grants</h3>
<h4>Stanford Institute for Innovation in Developing Economies</h4>
<p>Website: <a href="https://seed.stanford.edu/research/request-proposals" title="https://seed.stanford.edu/research/request-proposals">https://seed.stanford.edu/research/request-proposals</a><br />
	Deadline: October to December</p>
<hr /><h4>Stanford Humanities Center</h4>
<p>Deadline: early to mid January<br />
	a. Geballe Dissertation Prize<br />
	b. Mellon Foundation Dissertation Fellowship<br />
	c. G.J. Lieberman Fellowship, requires a distinguished record of university teaching</p>
<ul><li>contact &amp; biographical info,</li>
	<li>CV,</li>
	<li>current unofficial transcript (download from AXESS),</li>
	<li>timetable for completion of the degree,</li>
	<li>a statement for significance (100 max. words),</li>
	<li>a brief description of the research project (1,000 max. words),</li>
	<li>Two (2) reference letters, one from the advisor, and</li>
	<li>For Lieberman applicants, a teaching statement (1-2 pages), info on courses taught, teaching evaluation summary sheets for 3 courses</li>
</ul><hr /><h4>Research Institute of Comparative Studies in Race and Ethnicity (RICSRE)</h4>
<p>a. Graduate Dissertation Fellowship:</p>
<ul><li>The online application form,</li>
	<li>A 2 page CV,</li>
	<li>A 3-5 page research statement (including all notes and references). The statement should include:
		<ol><li>A summary of your dissertation research, including its contribution to your field,</li>
			<li>A discussion of how your research contributes to the study of race, ethnicity, and culture,</li>
			<li>A description of how your research relates to the aims of CCSRE and how you will benefit from participating in the Center’s interdisciplinary fellowship program,</li>
			<li>Your current transcript (from Axess),</li>
			<li>A timetable for the completion of your degree, and</li>
			<li>Two (2) letters of recommendation from Stanford faculty. Letters should evaluate the quality of the research project and what is needed for its successful and timely completion. One must be from the principal dissertation advisor.</li>
		</ol></li>
</ul><p>b. Graduate Teaching Fellowship:<br />
	Fellow duties:</p>
<ul><li>Serve two TA quarters and one fellowship quarter;</li>
	<li>Serve as a TA in one or two CSRE courses—lead two discussion sections per course (as needed); read and grade all student papers, exams, and other required assignments (in consultation with the faculty instructor); meet weekly with the course instructor and other TAs; and hold weekly office hours;</li>
	<li>Depending on enrollments and the need of the CSRE courses offered in 2014-2015, fellows may have the opportunity to teach his/her own course on a subject approved by the CSRE Curriculum Committee. The course should be designed in consultation with the student’s Ph.D. advisor;</li>
	<li>Pursue dissertation research and writing during the fellowship (non-teaching) quarter;</li>
</ul><p>Required documents:</p>
<ul><li>The online application form;</li>
	<li>A 2 page curriculum vitae;</li>
	<li>Your current transcript (from Axess);</li>
	<li>A 3-5 page course proposal describing a class that the applicant might teach for CSRE. Proposals should include course readings;</li>
	<li>Copies of course evaluations or teaching portfolio (if available); and</li>
	<li>Two (2) letters of recommendation from Stanford faculty. Letters should evaluate the quality of the applicant's teaching experience and graduate studies.</li>
</ul><hr /><h3>Additional on-campus grants to consider:</h3>
<h4>O'Bie Shultz Dissertation Completion Grant</h4>
<p>Application Info:</p>
<ul><li>Curriculum Vitae;</li>
	<li>Detailed Project Description. This description should be clear and concise, especially to readers outside of your discipline, and should be no longer than five double-spaced or three single-spaced typewritten pages. The description should include the following:
		<ol><li>The principal focus of the topic; and</li>
			<li>How the data will be organized in the dissertation; -Your interpretation of how your topic relates to international studies.</li>
		</ol></li>
	<li>Research Timetable Explain where the research now stands, what will be accomplished during the grant period, and what will remain to be done. Estimate the date of completion of the research. Should be no longer than one page;</li>
	<li>Statement of Income: A statement of anticipated grants, loans, and other sources of income should be disclosed with every application. Cost of living awards to students in the dissertation write-up stage of their academic career will be awarded at a standardized level (to be established annually by FSI) and a detailed expense budget is not required, unless living outside of the San Francisco Bay Area.</li>
	<li>Transcripts Transcripts should cover all graduate work, including evidence of work recently completed. Current printouts from Axess are accepted; and</li>
	<li>Required, but not necessarily included in packet from student: Recommendation Letters (not required to be included in packet from student) No more than three (3) letters of recommendation. Applicants should provide a copy of the Request for Letter of Recommendation and Instructions for Letter of Recommendation (contained in application file) to each individual asked to write a letter of recommendation. The form contains information pertaining to the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act. Applicants must indicate by signature whether or not s/he waives the right to inspect the completed recommendation. The letters should come from faculty members, one of whom is the applicant's major advisor, directly to the Fellowship Coordinator. All envelopes should be addressed to the FSI O'Bie Shultz Committee. Letters may be included with the applicants materials if the letters are in individually signed and sealed envelope(s), accompanied by the Request for Letter of Recommendation form</li>
</ul><hr /><h4>Center on Democracy, Development, and the Rule of Law’s Pre-Doctoral Fellowship</h4>
<p>Approximate deadline: mid-January.<br />
	Application Info:</p>
<ul><li>Applicants are required to submit a completed application form, letter of application of no more than 3 typed pages, current resume, three (3) letters of recommendations, a statement of proposed research (5-10 pages) and a complete set of transcripts (undergraduate and graduate). The Center Committee will only review complete files. Notifications will be sent in mid to late-March.</li>
</ul><hr /><h4>Center for International Security and Cooperation’s Pre-Doctoral Fellowships</h4>
<p>a. Social Sciences or Humanities International Security Fellowship (a variety of security topics, including: nuclear weapons policy and nonproliferation; nuclear energy; cybersecurity, cyberwarfare, and the future of the Internet; biosecurity and global health; implications of geostrategic shifts; insurgency, terrorism, and homeland security; war and civil conflict; consolidating peace after conflict; as well as global governance, migration, and transnational flows, from norms to criminal trafficking) and<br /><br />
	b. Law and International Security Fellowship in partnership with Stanford Law School (open to lawyers, law students, and social scientists who wish to conduct research projects at the intersection of law and international security). The fellowship is currently closed but the deadline for last year was mid January.<br /><br />
	Application Info:</p>
<ul><li>Completed online application form;</li>
	<li>Resume/CV;</li>
	<li>Graduate school transcript (Unofficial transcripts are acceptable. All pre- and postdoctoral applicants must include a transcript. Junior faculty and professionals may include a transcript, but are not required to do so.);</li>
	<li>Research project prospectus or description of dissertation (1,500 words max., not including footnotes/endnotes);</li>
	<li>Research abstract (200 words max.);</li>
	<li>Writing sample (50 pages max.); and</li>
	<li>Three (3) confidential letters of recommendation. Please note that recommendation letter services, such as Interfolio, may not use our online recommendation letter submission system. Please advise your recommenders to upload their letters directly to the CollegeNET system. Alternatively, letters may be submitted via email to the address listed below or by mail to the address listed below.</li>
</ul></div></div></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>

  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jsa-layouts-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Graduate Program</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jsa_layouts-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-1215"><a href="/graduate-program" title="">Graduate Program Overview</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1239"><a href="/graduate-program/doctoral-program" title="">Doctoral Program</a></li>

<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2109"><a href="https://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;catalog=&amp;page=0&amp;q=ANTHRO&amp;filter-catalognumber-ANTHRO=on&amp;filt" title="menu link directs people to anthropology courses on Stanford Bulletin Explore Courses site">Courses</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-3142"><a href="/graduate-program/anthropology-graduate-student-organization">Graduate Student Organization</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-1255"><a href="/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references" title="">Graduate Forms and References</a></li>
<li class="last expanded active-trail menu-mlid-1253 dropdown-submenu"><a href="/graduate-program/intra-and-extra-mural-funding" title="" class="active-trail dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Intra- and Extra-Mural Funding</a><ul class="dropdown-menu"><li class="first leaf active-trail active menu-mlid-2113"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-area-studies-and-language-training" class="active-trail active">Funding Opportunities for Area Studies and Language Training</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2115"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-graduate-training">Funding Opportunities for Graduate Training (includes opportunities for application both pre- and post- graduate admission to a Doctoral degree program)</a></li>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Funding Opportunities for Area Studies and Language Training </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-157" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-area-studies-and-language-training" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Funding Opportunities for Area Studies and Language Training" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p><strong>Critical Language Scholarship Program</strong><br />
	Website: <a href="http://clscholarship.org/qv_applicant.php" title="http://clscholarship.org/qv_applicant.php" rel="nofollow">http://clscholarship.org/qv_applicant.php</a><br />
	Deadline: November<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>America Indian Institute of Indian Studies</strong><br />
	Website: <a href="http://www.indiastudies.org/language-programs/" title="http://www.indiastudies.org/language-programs/" rel="nofollow">http://www.indiastudies.org/language-programs/</a><br />
	Deadline: January<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Foreign Language and Area Studies (FLAS) [Department of Education]</strong><br />
	Website: <a href="http://www2.ed.gov/programs/iegpsflasf/index.html" title="http://www2.ed.gov/programs/iegpsflasf/index.html" rel="nofollow">http://www2.ed.gov/programs/iegpsflasf/index.html</a><br /><a href="http://ceas.stanford.edu/docs/fellowship/Graduate%20AY%20FLAS%20Guidelines.pdf" title="http://ceas.stanford.edu/docs/fellowship/Graduate%20AY%20FLAS%20Guidelines.pdf">http://ceas.stanford.edu/docs/fellowship/Graduate%20AY%20FLAS%20Guidelin...</a><br /><a href="http://africanstudies.stanford.edu/fellowships/flas_fellowships" title="http://africanstudies.stanford.edu/fellowships/flas_fellowships">http://africanstudies.stanford.edu/fellowships/flas_fellowships</a><br /><a href="http://creees.stanford.edu/node/285" title="http://creees.stanford.edu/node/285">http://creees.stanford.edu/node/285</a><br /><a href="http://las.stanford.edu/grants-and-fellowships/for-graduate-students/flas-fellowships" title="http://las.stanford.edu/grants-and-fellowships/for-graduate-students/flas-fellowships">http://las.stanford.edu/grants-and-fellowships/for-graduate-students/fla...</a><br />
	Deadline: (see sponsoring academic institution specific information)<br />
	Source: External/Internal</p>
<p><strong>ICA Division of International Comparative &amp; Area Studies (Funding Support for Students)</strong><br />
	Website: <a href="http://ica.stanford.edu/funding" title="http://ica.stanford.edu/funding">http://ica.stanford.edu/funding</a><br />
	Deadline: Various<br />
	Source: Internal</p>
</div></div></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Funding Opportunities for Dissertation Research </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-161" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-dissertation-research" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Funding Opportunities for Dissertation Research" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>These research grants and fellowships are designed to assist students performing dissertation research. They vary widely in eligibility conditions, application requirements and types of research sponsored. Applicants are strongly encouraged to carefully read program details and to work closely with their advisors throughout the proposal writing phase of their application.</p>
<p><strong>Fulbright Scholarships</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://icenter.stanford.edu/orc/fulbright.html" title="http://icenter.stanford.edu/orc/fulbright.html">http://icenter.stanford.edu/orc/fulbright.html</a><br />
	Deadline: September<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Ford Foundation</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://sites.nationalacademies.org/PGA/FordFellowships/PGA_047959" title="http://sites.nationalacademies.org/PGA/FordFellowships/PGA_047959" rel="nofollow">http://sites.nationalacademies.org/PGA/FordFellowships/PGA_047959</a><br />
	Deadline: November<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>George Melendez Wright Climate Change Fellowship</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://coenv.washington.edu/students/melendez_wright/" title="http://coenv.washington.edu/students/melendez_wright/" rel="nofollow">http://coenv.washington.edu/students/melendez_wright/</a><br />
	Deadline: November<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Social Science Research Council (SSRC) International Dissertation Research Fellowship</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://www.ssrc.org/fellowships/idrf-fellowship/" title="http://www.ssrc.org/fellowships/idrf-fellowship/" rel="nofollow">http://www.ssrc.org/fellowships/idrf-fellowship/</a><br />
	Deadline: November<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Vice Provost for Graduate Education (VPGE) Diversity Dissertation Research opportunity Fund (DDRO)</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://vpge.stanford.edu/programs/ddro.html" title="http://vpge.stanford.edu/programs/ddro.html">http://vpge.stanford.edu/programs/ddro.html</a><br />
	Deadline: November and April<br />
	Source: Stanford</p>
<p><strong>Graduate Research Opportunities (GRO)</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://www.stanford.edu/dept/humsci/cgi-bin/gus/content/current-funding#GRO" title="http://www.stanford.edu/dept/humsci/cgi-bin/gus/content/current-funding#GRO">http://www.stanford.edu/dept/humsci/cgi-bin/gus/content/current-funding#GRO</a><br />
	Deadline: November and April<br />
	Source: Stanford</p>
<p><strong>The Wenner-Gren Foundation, Dissertation Fieldwork Grants</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://www.wennergren.org/programs/dissertation-fieldwork-grants" title="http://www.wennergren.org/programs/dissertation-fieldwork-grants" rel="nofollow">http://www.wennergren.org/programs/dissertation-fieldwork-grants</a><br />
	Deadline: November and May<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Chateaubriand Fellowship - Humanities &amp; Social Sciences (HSS)</strong><br />
	Website: <a href="http://humanities.chateaubriand-fellowship.org/" title="http://humanities.chateaubriand-fellowship.org/" rel="nofollow">http://humanities.chateaubriand-fellowship.org/</a><br />
	Deadline: January<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Smithsonian Institution Fellowship Program</strong><br />
	Website: <a href="http://www.si.edu/OFI/SIFELL" title="http://www.si.edu/OFI/SIFELL" rel="nofollow">http://www.si.edu/OFI/SIFELL</a><br />
	Deadline: January<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Smithsonian Institution Latino Studies Fellowship Program</strong><br />
	Website: <a href="http://www.si.edu/ofg/Applications/LSFELL/LSFELLapp.htm" title="http://www.si.edu/ofg/Applications/LSFELL/LSFELLapp.htm" rel="nofollow">http://www.si.edu/ofg/Applications/LSFELL/LSFELLapp.htm</a><br />
	Deadline: January<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>National Sciences Foundation - Law and Social Sciences program</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://www.nsf.gov/sbe/ses/law/lawguide1.jsp" title="http://www.nsf.gov/sbe/ses/law/lawguide1.jsp" rel="nofollow">http://www.nsf.gov/sbe/ses/law/lawguide1.jsp</a><br />
	Deadline: January<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada, Joseph-Armand Bombardier Canada </strong><br />
	Graduate Scholarships Program Doctoral Scholarships, and SSHRC Doctoral Fellowships<br />
	website: <a href="http://www.sshrc-crsh.gc.ca/funding-financement/programs-programmes/fellowships/doctoral-doctorat-eng.aspx" title="http://www.sshrc-crsh.gc.ca/funding-financement/programs-programmes/fellowships/doctoral-doctorat-eng.aspx" rel="nofollow">http://www.sshrc-crsh.gc.ca/funding-financement/programs-programmes/fell...</a><br />
	Deadline: January<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Vice Provost for Graduate Education (VPGE) Stanford Interdisciplinary Graduate Fellowship (SIGF)</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://vpge.stanford.edu/SIGF/SIGF_apply.html" title="http://vpge.stanford.edu/SIGF/SIGF_apply.html">http://vpge.stanford.edu/SIGF/SIGF_apply.html</a><br />
	Deadline: January and March<br />
	Source: Stanford</p>
<p><strong>National Science Foundation - Cultural Anthropology program</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://www.nsf.gov/sbe/bcs/anthro/suppdiss.jsp" title="http://www.nsf.gov/sbe/bcs/anthro/suppdiss.jsp" rel="nofollow">http://www.nsf.gov/sbe/bcs/anthro/suppdiss.jsp</a><br />
	Deadline: January and August<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>National Science Foundation - Biological Anthropology</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://www.nsf.gov/funding/pgm_summ.jsp?pims_id=5407" title="http://www.nsf.gov/funding/pgm_summ.jsp?pims_id=5407" rel="nofollow">http://www.nsf.gov/funding/pgm_summ.jsp?pims_id=5407</a><br />
	Deadline: January and August<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Fulbright Public Policy Fellowship</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://icenter.stanford.edu/orc/fulbright-public-policy.html" title="http://icenter.stanford.edu/orc/fulbright-public-policy.html">http://icenter.stanford.edu/orc/fulbright-public-policy.html</a><br />
	Deadline: February<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Susan Ford Dorsey Fellowship for Field Research in Africa</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://africanstudies.stanford.edu/node/1137" title="http://africanstudies.stanford.edu/node/1137">http://africanstudies.stanford.edu/node/1137</a><br />
	Deadline: May<br />
	Source: Stanford</p>
<p><strong>Fulbright Hays</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://icenter.stanford.edu/orc/ful_hays.html" title="http://icenter.stanford.edu/orc/ful_hays.html">http://icenter.stanford.edu/orc/ful_hays.html</a><br />
	Deadline: June<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>American Institute of Indian Studies Junior Research Fellowship</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://www.indiastudies.org/research-fellowship-programs/categories-of-fellowship/" title="http://www.indiastudies.org/research-fellowship-programs/categories-of-fellowship/" rel="nofollow">http://www.indiastudies.org/research-fellowship-programs/categories-of-f...</a><br />
	Deadline: July<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>National Science Foundation - Archaeology program</strong><br />
	website: <a href="http://www.nsf.gov/sbe/bcs/arch/suppdiss.jsp" title="http://www.nsf.gov/sbe/bcs/arch/suppdiss.jsp" rel="nofollow">http://www.nsf.gov/sbe/bcs/arch/suppdiss.jsp</a><br />
	Deadline: No deadline<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Freeman Spogli Institute</strong><br />

<p><strong>Robert and Patricia Switzer Foundation Fellowship Program</strong><br />

          <div class="row-fluid"><div class="region region-sidebar-first clearfix">
  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jsa-layouts-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Graduate Program</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jsa_layouts-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-1215"><a href="/graduate-program" title="">Graduate Program Overview</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1239"><a href="/graduate-program/doctoral-program" title="">Doctoral Program</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1245"><a href="/graduate-program/master-degree-program">Master Degree Program</a></li>

<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1251"><a href="/graduate-program/graduate-admission">Admission</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2109"><a href="https://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;catalog=&amp;page=0&amp;q=ANTHRO&amp;filter-catalognumber-ANTHRO=on&amp;filt" title="menu link directs people to anthropology courses on Stanford Bulletin Explore Courses site">Courses</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-3142"><a href="/graduate-program/anthropology-graduate-student-organization">Graduate Student Organization</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-1255"><a href="/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references" title="">Graduate Forms and References</a></li>
<li class="last expanded active-trail menu-mlid-1253 dropdown-submenu"><a href="/graduate-program/intra-and-extra-mural-funding" title="" class="active-trail dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Intra- and Extra-Mural Funding</a><ul class="dropdown-menu"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-2113"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-area-studies-and-language-training">Funding Opportunities for Area Studies and Language Training</a></li>
<li class="leaf active-trail active menu-mlid-2115"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-graduate-training" class="active-trail active">Funding Opportunities for Graduate Training (includes opportunities for application both pre- and post- graduate admission to a Doctoral degree program)</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2117"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-dissertation-research">Funding Opportunities for Dissertation Research</a></li>
<li class="last leaf menu-mlid-2119"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunites-dissertation-writing-and-completion" title="">Funding Opportunities for Dissertation Writing and Completion</a></li>
</ul></li>
</ul></div>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Funding Opportunities for Graduate Training </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-159" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-graduate-training" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Funding Opportunities for Graduate Training" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>The funding opportunities listed below, are structured to provide financial support for graduate students at the early stages of their graduate studies. Grants and fellowships awards can be given for one or more years.</p>
<br /><p><strong>National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship</strong><br />
	Website: <a href="http://nsfgrfp.org/" title="http://nsfgrfp.org/" rel="nofollow">http://nsfgrfp.org/</a><br />
	Deadline: November (this extramural funding application may submitted before submission of a graduate admission application to a Ph.D. degree program)<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Paul &amp; Daisy Soros Fellowships for New Americans</strong><br />
	Website: <a href="http://nsfgrfp.org/" title="http://nsfgrfp.org/" rel="nofollow">http://nsfgrfp.org/</a><br />
	Website: <a href="http://www.pdsoros.org/" title="http://www.pdsoros.org/" rel="nofollow">http://www.pdsoros.org/</a><br />
	Deadline: November<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Science to Achieve Results (STAR) Fellowships</strong><br />
	Website: <a href="http://epa.gov/ncer/rfa/2013/2013_star_gradfellow.html#Synopsis" title="http://epa.gov/ncer/rfa/2013/2013_star_gradfellow.html#Synopsis" rel="nofollow">http://epa.gov/ncer/rfa/2013/2013_star_gradfellow.html#Synopsis</a><br />
	Deadline: November<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Wenner-Gren: The Wadsworth African Fellowships</strong><br />
	Website: <a href="http://nsfgrfp.org/" title="http://nsfgrfp.org/" rel="nofollow">http://nsfgrfp.org/</a><br />
	Website: <a href="http://www.wennergren.org/programs/wadsworth-african-fellowships" title="http://www.wennergren.org/programs/wadsworth-african-fellowships" rel="nofollow">http://www.wennergren.org/programs/wadsworth-african-fellowships</a><br />
	Deadline: December<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Wenner-Gren: Wadsworth International Fellowships</strong><br />
	Website: <a href="http://nsfgrfp.org/" title="http://nsfgrfp.org/" rel="nofollow">http://nsfgrfp.org/</a><br />
	Website: <a href="http://www.wennergren.org/programs/wadsworth-international-fellowships" title="http://www.wennergren.org/programs/wadsworth-international-fellowships" rel="nofollow">http://www.wennergren.org/programs/wadsworth-international-fellowships</a><br />
	Deadline: March<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Center for South Asia Fellowships</strong><br />
	Website: <a href="http://southasia.stanford.edu/fellowships" title="http://southasia.stanford.edu/fellowships">http://southasia.stanford.edu/fellowships</a><br />
	Deadline: April<br />
	Source: Internal</p>
<p><strong>Explorers Club</strong><br />
	Website: <a href="http://www.explorers.org" title="http://www.explorers.org" rel="nofollow">http://www.explorers.org</a><br />
	Deadline: November<br />
	Source: External</p>
<p><strong>Knight-Hennessy Scholars Program</strong><br />
	Website: <a href="https://knight-hennessy.stanford.edu">https://knight-hennessy.stanford.edu</a><br />
	Deadline: September (this intramural Scholars Program application must be submitted before submission of a graduate admissions application to a Ph.D. degree program)<br />
	Source: Internal</p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>

<meta name="description" content="General Information The Department of Anthropology offers the following advanced degrees: the Master of Arts (MA) in Anthropology and the Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) in Anthropology. Admissions Calendar The Graduate Admissions season is open beginning in September each year for applications to be submitted by the published deadline in December [for matriculation beginning in the following academic year]. Decision status information will be available in March. After April 15th each year, the Graduate Admissions season is closed until the following September." />

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Graduate Admission </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-87" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/graduate-admission" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Graduate Admission" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h3>General Information</h3>
<p>The Department of Anthropology offers the following advanced degrees: the Master of Arts (MA) in Anthropology and the Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) in Anthropology.</p>
<h3>Admissions Calendar</h3>
<p>The Graduate Admissions season is open beginning in September each year for applications to be submitted by the published deadline in December [for matriculation beginning in the following academic year]. Decision status information will be available in March. After April 15th each year, the Graduate Admissions season is closed until the following September.</p>
<p>April 2017 - August 2017: Graduate Application period is closed<br />
	September 2017 - December 2017: Graduate Application period opens<br />
	March 2018 - Decision status is available</p>
<p> </p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>

            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Page Not Found  </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-79" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/node/79" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Page Not Found " class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h2>Please email the <a href="mailto:ebishop1@stanford.edu">webmaster</a> and describe how you got to this page.  Thank you.</h2>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>

          <div class="row-fluid"><div class="region region-sidebar-first clearfix">
  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jsa-layouts-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Graduate Program</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jsa_layouts-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-1215"><a href="/graduate-program" title="">Graduate Program Overview</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1239"><a href="/graduate-program/doctoral-program" title="">Doctoral Program</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1245"><a href="/graduate-program/master-degree-program">Master Degree Program</a></li>
<li class="leaf active-trail active menu-mlid-2822"><a href="/graduate-program/graduate-program-tracks" class="active-trail active">Tracks within Graduate Program</a></li>

<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2109"><a href="https://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;catalog=&amp;page=0&amp;q=ANTHRO&amp;filter-catalognumber-ANTHRO=on&amp;filt" title="menu link directs people to anthropology courses on Stanford Bulletin Explore Courses site">Courses</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-3142"><a href="/graduate-program/anthropology-graduate-student-organization">Graduate Student Organization</a></li>

<li class="last collapsed menu-mlid-1253"><a href="/graduate-program/intra-and-extra-mural-funding" title="">Intra- and Extra-Mural Funding</a></li>
</ul></div>

        <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Graduate Program Tracks </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-990" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/graduate-program-tracks" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Graduate Program Tracks" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Students may pursue two different tracks in the Anthropology Ph.D. degree program. The tracks are not declarable in AXESS; they do not appear on the transcript or the diploma. </p>
<p style="line-height:1px;"><a name="cs" id="cs"> </a></p>
<h3>Culture and Society</h3>
<p style="float:left; margin-right: 20px;"><img alt="liisa4.jpg" class="img-frame" height="219" src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/culture-society.jpg" width="300" /></p>
<p>The scope of cultural and social anthropology at Stanford includes the study of the full range of human societies and cultures, especially as these are drawn together in transnational and global interactions. The Culture and Society track faculty are committed to an intellectually rigorous and socially responsible pursuit of answers to questions that urgently matter in the contemporary world. The track has a focus on understanding a wide range of issues in the comparative study of society and culture. These include issues of:</p>
<p style="clear:both; line-height:1px;"> </p>
<ul><li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/anthropology-religion">anthropology of religion;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/anthropology-and-arts">anthropology and the arts; </a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/anthropology-science-and-technology">anthropology of science;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/cities">cities; </a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/colonialism-and-indigeneity">colonialism and indigeneity;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/culture-and-mind">culture and mind;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/cultural-politics-and-nation-state">cultural politics and the nation state; </a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/ethnicity-and-collective-identity">ethnicity and collective identity;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/gender-and-sexuality">gender and sexuality;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/linguistic-anthropology">linguistic anthropology;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/medical-anthropology">medical anthropology;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/transnational-and-global-political-economy">transnational and global political economy;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/development-conservation-and-humanitarianism">development, conservation, and humanitarianism; and</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/sovereignty-modern-state-and-biopolitics">sovereignty, the modern state and biopolitics.</a></li>
</ul><p>Faculty are engaged in ethnographic and documentary research informed by a wide array of theoretical perspectives, and focused on both traditional and emerging topics.</p>
<p style="line-height:1px;"><a name="arch" id="arch"> </a></p>
<h3>Archaeology</h3>
<p><img alt="" class="img-frame" height="279" src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/catal_1.jpg" style="float:right; margin-left:20px;" width="400" />The archaeology track is committed to giving students a strong basis in the discipline and its ethical standards while providing the opportunity for diverse and open-minded inquiry in facing the challenges that confront archaeologists today. There is a strong global range of interests, with student and faculty researchers working from Southeast Asia to Europe, Africa and the Americas. These research interests include:</p>
<ul><li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/cities">Cities;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/colonialism-and-indigeneity">Colonialism and Indigeneity;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/anthropology-and-arts">Anthropology and Art;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/ethnicity-and-collective-identity">Ethnicity and Collective identity;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/gender-and-sexuality">Gender and sexuality;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/global-heritage">Global heritage;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/materiality">Materiality; and </a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/research-projects/world-archaeology">World Archaeology.</a></li>
</ul><p>Students accepted into the graduate program participate in the activities of the Archaeology Center. The Center through the cutting-edge research carried out in its research laboratories and through its program of distinguished visiting scholars, workshops and public lecture programs provides a forum for interaction amongst faculty and students in different parts of the University and gives students opportunities to engage in multi- and interdisciplinary research in archaeology and related fields.</p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">

          <div class="row-fluid"><div class="region region-sidebar-first clearfix">
  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jsa-layouts-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Graduate Program</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jsa_layouts-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-1215"><a href="/graduate-program" title="">Graduate Program Overview</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1239"><a href="/graduate-program/doctoral-program" title="">Doctoral Program</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1245"><a href="/graduate-program/master-degree-program">Master Degree Program</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2822"><a href="/graduate-program/graduate-program-tracks">Tracks within Graduate Program</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1251"><a href="/graduate-program/graduate-admission">Admission</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2109"><a href="https://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;catalog=&amp;page=0&amp;q=ANTHRO&amp;filter-catalognumber-ANTHRO=on&amp;filt" title="menu link directs people to anthropology courses on Stanford Bulletin Explore Courses site">Courses</a></li>
<li class="expanded active-trail menu-mlid-3142 dropdown-submenu"><a href="/graduate-program/anthropology-graduate-student-organization" class="active-trail dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Graduate Student Organization</a><ul class="dropdown-menu"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-4220"><a href="/graduate-program/graduate-student-organization/gso-representatives">GSO Representatives</a></li>
<li class="last leaf active-trail menu-mlid-4222"><a href="/graduate-program/graduate-student-organization/gso-conferences" title="" class="active-trail">GSO Conferences</a></li>
</ul></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-1255"><a href="/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references" title="">Graduate Forms and References</a></li>

</ul></div>
 </div>
</div>

        </div>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title">  2012 Graduate Student Conference </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-1258" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/graduate-student-organization/2012-graduate-student-conference" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content=" 2012 Graduate Student Conference" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong>  Thursday, October 11, 2012 - 7:30pm</p>
<p><strong>Flyer:</strong><br /><img alt="" class="img-frame" height="906" src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/2012_gradconference_0_0.jpg" width="700" /></p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> GSO Conferences </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-1254" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/graduate-student-organization/gso-conferences" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="GSO Conferences" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-program/graduate-student-organization/2012-graduate-student-conference"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/matches.jpg" width="150" height="150" alt="Matches.jpg" class="float-left img-frame" /></a></p>
<p class="float-left" style="margin:45px 0 0 25px;"><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-program/graduate-student-organization/2012-graduate-student-conference"><span style="line-height: 22px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold;">Graduate Student Conference,<br /> Stanford University, <br />October 10-12, 2012</span></a></p>
<p style="clear: both;"> </p>
<p><a href="http://www.stanford.edu/group/anthrograds/home.html"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/2010gso.jpg" width="150" height="150" alt="2010gso.jpg" class="float-left img-frame" style="margin-right:25px;" /></a></p>
<p class="float-left" style="margin:45px 0 0 25px;"><a href="http://www.stanford.edu/group/anthrograds/home.html"><span style="line-height: 22px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold;">Graduate Student Conference,<br /> Stanford University, <br />April 23-24, 2010</span></a></p>
<p style="clear: both;"> </p>
<p><a href="https://www.stanford.edu/dept/anthropology/globalproductions/"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/2006gso.jpg" width="150" height="150" alt="2006gso.jpg" class="float-left img-frame" style="margin-right:25px;" /></a></p>
<p class="float-left" style="margin:45px 0 0 25px;"><a href="https://web.stanford.edu/dept/anthropology/globalproductions/"><span style="line-height: 22px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold; margin-top: 30px;">Graduate Student Conference, <br />Stanford University,  <br />April 7-8, 2006  </span></a></p>
<p style="clear: both;"> </p>
<p> </p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-c91908ef583ad31af241804ddca10693">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> GSO Representatives </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-1252" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/graduate-student-organization/gso-representatives" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="GSO Representatives" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>GSO representatives are volunteer leaders from across the department’s student cohorts and degree tracks. Each representative normally serves for two years.</p>
<div class="float-left img-frame"><img alt="Tienyu Xie - 2017-2018 GSO rep" class="image-large-scaled" height="100" src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/large-scaled/public/pabloseward_square_0.jpg?itok=xNnds4wS" width="100" /></div>
<h4>Pablo Seward</h4>
<p>Pablo is a third-year doctoral student in the Culture and Society track whose current research concerns issues related to biopolitics, risk, subjectivity, and ethics in migrant squatter settlements in Chile.<br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/people/pablo-seward">Profile</a> | <a href="https://stanfordwho.stanford.edu/SWApp/Search.do?search=pablo%20seward" target="_blank">Directory</a></p>
<p style="clear:both; line-height:.7px; border-bottom:1px dotted #b09d72"> </p>
<div class="float-left img-frame"><img alt="John Moran - 2017-2018 GSO rep" class="image-large-scaled" height="100" src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/large-scaled/public/johnmoran_small.jpg?itok=qDu0z09p" width="100" /></div>
<h4><strong>John Moran</strong></h4>
<p>John is a fifth-year doctoral candidate in the Culture and Society track, writing about nature interpretation, water management, and identity in North Florida.<br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/people/john-moran">Profile</a> | <a href="https://stanfordwho.stanford.edu/SWApp/lookup?search=%27John%20Moran" target="_blank">Directory</a></p>
<p style="clear:both; line-height:.7px; border-bottom:1px dotted #b09d72"> </p>
<div class="float-left img-frame"><img alt="Paul Christian - 2017-2018 GSO rep" class="image-large-scaled" height="100" src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/large-scaled/public/paulchristians_small.jpg?itok=g-PWaCpN" width="100" /></div>
<h4><strong>Paul Christians </strong></h4>
<p>Paul is a third-year doctoral student in the Archaeology track, focused on the intersections of heritage, archaeology, and politics in the Gulf and Middle East.<br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/people/paul-christians">Profile</a> | <a href="https://stanfordwho.stanford.edu/SWApp/lookup?search=%27Paul%20Christians" target="_blank">Directory</a></p>
<p style="clear:both; line-height:.7px; border-bottom:1px dotted #b09d72"> </p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-is-this-a-job-posting- field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>

  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-b1637f00a1bae5e49eaf185b881c551a">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div><div id="block-views-stanford-media-media" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-media view-id-stanford_media view-display-id-media view-dom-id-7fb6a4b6b0d5a5e585d518824206f2e5">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">

<div id="footer" class="clearfix footer site-footer">
  <div class="container">
        <div id="footer-content" class="row-fluid footer-content"> <div class="region region-footer clearfix">
  <div id="block-menu-menu-footer-about-menu" class="clearfix block block-menu span2">     <h2>Academics</h2>
      <div class="content"> <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf"><a href="/graduate-program" title="">Graduate Program</a></li>
<li class="leaf"><a href="/undergraduate-program" title="">Undergraduate Program</a></li>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Page Not Found  </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-79" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/node/79" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Page Not Found " class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h2>Please email the <a href="mailto:ebishop1@stanford.edu">webmaster</a> and describe how you got to this page.  Thank you.</h2>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>

        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>

          <div class="row-fluid"><div class="region region-sidebar-first clearfix">
  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jsa-layouts-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Graduate Program</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jsa_layouts-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-1215"><a href="/graduate-program" title="">Graduate Program Overview</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1239"><a href="/graduate-program/doctoral-program" title="">Doctoral Program</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1245"><a href="/graduate-program/master-degree-program">Master Degree Program</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2822"><a href="/graduate-program/graduate-program-tracks">Tracks within Graduate Program</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1251"><a href="/graduate-program/graduate-admission">Admission</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2109"><a href="https://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;catalog=&amp;page=0&amp;q=ANTHRO&amp;filter-catalognumber-ANTHRO=on&amp;filt" title="menu link directs people to anthropology courses on Stanford Bulletin Explore Courses site">Courses</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-3142"><a href="/graduate-program/anthropology-graduate-student-organization">Graduate Student Organization</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-1255"><a href="/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references" title="">Graduate Forms and References</a></li>
<li class="last expanded active-trail active menu-mlid-1253 dropdown-submenu"><a href="/graduate-program/intra-and-extra-mural-funding" title="" class="active-trail dropdown-toggle active" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Intra- and Extra-Mural Funding</a><ul class="dropdown-menu"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-2113"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-area-studies-and-language-training">Funding Opportunities for Area Studies and Language Training</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2115"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-graduate-training">Funding Opportunities for Graduate Training (includes opportunities for application both pre- and post- graduate admission to a Doctoral degree program)</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2117"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunities-dissertation-research">Funding Opportunities for Dissertation Research</a></li>
<li class="last leaf menu-mlid-2119"><a href="/graduate-program/funding-resources/funding-opportunites-dissertation-writing-and-completion" title="">Funding Opportunities for Dissertation Writing and Completion</a></li>
</ul></li>
</ul></div>
 </div>
</div>
</div>
 <!-- /.region -->
</div>
        </div>
        <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Intra- and Extra-Mural Funding </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-83" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/intra-and-extra-mural-funding" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Intra- and Extra-Mural Funding" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>This section provides anthropology graduate (and, in some cases undergraduate students) with information to identify and apply for grants and fellowships at a variety of stages during a  graduate academic career. The resources provided below direct students to common grant and fellowship sponsoring organizations at Stanford University (intramural) and at organizations external to Stanford University (extramural)</p>
<p>The Department of Anthropology is not responsible for the content or information provided below.</p>
<p><a class="more-link" href="http://med.stanford.edu/rmg/funding/funding_database.html" title="http://med.stanford.edu/rmg/funding/funding_database.html">http://med.stanford.edu/rmg/funding/funding_database.html</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://highwire.stanford.edu/lists/portals.dtl" title="http://highwire.stanford.edu/lists/portals.dtl">http://highwire.stanford.edu/lists/portals.dtl</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://www-sul.stanford.edu/guides/funding.html" title="http://www-sul.stanford.edu/guides/funding.html">http://www-sul.stanford.edu/guides/funding.html</a></p>
<p>Recommended webpage references for proposal and thesis writing (formatting and style) information include the following:<br /><a class="more-link" href="http://www-tcad.stanford.edu/%7Egoojs/RESEARCH/thesis.html" title="http://www-tcad.stanford.edu/~goojs/RESEARCH/thesis.html">http://www-tcad.stanford.edu/~goojs/RESEARCH/thesis.html</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://help-csli.stanford.edu/tex/suthesis" title="http://help-csli.stanford.edu/tex/suthesis">http://help-csli.stanford.edu/tex/suthesis</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://www.aaanet.org/publications/guidelines.cfm" title="http://www.aaanet.org/publications/guidelines.cfm" rel="nofollow">http://www.aaanet.org/publications/guidelines.cfm</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://esapubs.org/esapubs/preparation.htm" title="http://esapubs.org/esapubs/preparation.htm" rel="nofollow">http://esapubs.org/esapubs/preparation.htm</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://www.saa.org/AbouttheSociety/Publications/StyleGuide/tabid/984/Default.aspx" title="http://www.saa.org/AbouttheSociety/Publications/StyleGuide/tabid/984/Default.aspx" rel="nofollow">http://www.saa.org/AbouttheSociety/Publications/StyleGuide/tabid/984/Def...</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://www.press.uchicago.edu/journals/ca/style.html?journal=ca" title="http://www.press.uchicago.edu/journals/ca/style.html?journal=ca" rel="nofollow">http://www.press.uchicago.edu/journals/ca/style.html?journal=ca</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://www.sha.org/publications/for_authors.cfm" title="http://www.sha.org/publications/for_authors.cfm" rel="nofollow">http://www.sha.org/publications/for_authors.cfm</a><br /><a class="more-link" href="http://www.stanford.edu/%7Ejhj1/grant-advice.html" title="http://www.stanford.edu/~jhj1/grant-advice.html">http://www.stanford.edu/~jhj1/grant-advice.html</a></p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-c4e75fb9fee00a889c7aa32765b86540">

        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">

This is achieved through completion of courses in the primary field, as well as related areas, and through experience with independent work, area specialization and field research." />
