                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Master Degree Program </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-115" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/master-degree-program" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Master Degree Program" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h3 name="text">Master Program Learning Outcomes</h3>
<p>The purpose of the Master of Arts degree program is to further develop knowledge and skills in Anthropology and to prepare students for a professional career or doctoral studies. This is achieved through completion of courses in the primary field, as well as related areas, and through experience with independent work, area specialization and field research.</p>
<p>Download the Department of Anthropology Graduate Program Flyer and the Department of Anthropology Graduate Handbook for information concerning the Anthropology Graduate degree programs. These references can be found on the  <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references">Graduate Forms and References page</a>.</p>
<p>For more detailed description of the Anthropology Master of Arts Program, please refer to the <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofhumanitiesandsciences/anthropology/#masterstext" target="_blank">Stanford University Bulletin Explore Degrees </a>.</p>
<h3>Eligibility</h3>
<p>The Department of Anthropology offers the terminal master's degree to the following:</p>
<ol><li>Graduate applicants who apply from outside the University for admission to the terminal M.A. program in Anthropology.</li>
<li>Stanford graduate students, taking advanced degrees in other departments or schools at Stanford, who are admitted to the terminal M.A. program in Anthropology.</li>
<li>Anthropology Ph.D. students at Stanford University who fulfill the M.A. degree requirements on the way to the Ph.D. degree.</li>
</ol><p>Graduate applicants who apply from outside the University and whose ultimate goal is the Ph.D. degree should apply directly to the Ph.D. degree program. Applicants who are offered admission to the terminal M.A. degree program may not transfer to the Ph.D. degree program; they must reapply on the same basis as other Ph.D. applicants and in competition with the Ph.D. applicants.</p>
<p>Graduate students taking an advanced degree in other departments or schools at Stanford and who apply for admission to the M.A. in Anthropology are governed by separate requirements as described in the Anthropology Graduate Handbook and can be downloaded <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references" target="_blank">HERE</a>.</p>
<p>Anthropology Ph.D. students who decide to take the M.A. in Anthropology on the way to the Ph.D. are also governed by separate requirements described in the Anthropology Graduate Handbook which can be downloaded <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references" target="_blank">HERE</a>.</p>
<p>Graduate enrollment at Stanford University for three consecutive quarters of full tuition for at least 45 units is required of all candidates for the terminal master's degree. M.A. students in Anthropology must take a minimum of 45 units of Anthropology course work beyond the undergraduate degree with an overall grade point average of 3.0 or higher. 45 units constitute the University minimum for the M.A. degree, and courses must be at or above the 100 level.</p>
<p>The M.A. program may require more than one year of study. However, full-time students entering the program with appropriate background should complete the M.A. degree program within three consecutive calendar quarters after the student's first quarter of master's-level enrollment. The University allows no transfer units into the master's program. To provide a meaningful master's program within one year, advance planning of course work with an adviser is required. Requirements for the terminal master's program must be completed within three years.</p>
<h3><strong>Tracks within the M.A. Program</strong></h3>
<p>Students may pursue two different tracks in the Anthropology M.A. degree program. The tracks are not declarable in Axess; they do not appear on the transcript or the diploma. The tracks are:</p>
<ul><li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-program/graduate-program-tracks#arch">Archaeology</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-program/graduate-program-tracks#cs">Culture and Society</a></li>
</ul><p> </p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-4893361ff8f67a88ff3a578dcbef43bc">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">

This is achieved through completion of courses in the primary field, as well as related areas, and through experience with independent work, area specialization and field research." />

  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jsa-layouts-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Graduate Program</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jsa_layouts-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Master Degree Program </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-115" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/master-degree-program" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Master Degree Program" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h3 name="text">Master Program Learning Outcomes</h3>
<p>The purpose of the Master of Arts degree program is to further develop knowledge and skills in Anthropology and to prepare students for a professional career or doctoral studies. This is achieved through completion of courses in the primary field, as well as related areas, and through experience with independent work, area specialization and field research.</p>
<p>Download the Department of Anthropology Graduate Program Flyer and the Department of Anthropology Graduate Handbook for information concerning the Anthropology Graduate degree programs. These references can be found on the  <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references">Graduate Forms and References page</a>.</p>
<p>For more detailed description of the Anthropology Master of Arts Program, please refer to the <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofhumanitiesandsciences/anthropology/#masterstext" target="_blank">Stanford University Bulletin Explore Degrees </a>.</p>
<h3>Eligibility</h3>
<p>The Department of Anthropology offers the terminal master's degree to the following:</p>
<ol><li>Graduate applicants who apply from outside the University for admission to the terminal M.A. program in Anthropology.</li>
<li>Stanford graduate students, taking advanced degrees in other departments or schools at Stanford, who are admitted to the terminal M.A. program in Anthropology.</li>
<li>Anthropology Ph.D. students at Stanford University who fulfill the M.A. degree requirements on the way to the Ph.D. degree.</li>
</ol><p>Graduate applicants who apply from outside the University and whose ultimate goal is the Ph.D. degree should apply directly to the Ph.D. degree program. Applicants who are offered admission to the terminal M.A. degree program may not transfer to the Ph.D. degree program; they must reapply on the same basis as other Ph.D. applicants and in competition with the Ph.D. applicants.</p>
<p>Graduate students taking an advanced degree in other departments or schools at Stanford and who apply for admission to the M.A. in Anthropology are governed by separate requirements as described in the Anthropology Graduate Handbook and can be downloaded <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references" target="_blank">HERE</a>.</p>
<p>Anthropology Ph.D. students who decide to take the M.A. in Anthropology on the way to the Ph.D. are also governed by separate requirements described in the Anthropology Graduate Handbook which can be downloaded <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references" target="_blank">HERE</a>.</p>
<p>Graduate enrollment at Stanford University for three consecutive quarters of full tuition for at least 45 units is required of all candidates for the terminal master's degree. M.A. students in Anthropology must take a minimum of 45 units of Anthropology course work beyond the undergraduate degree with an overall grade point average of 3.0 or higher. 45 units constitute the University minimum for the M.A. degree, and courses must be at or above the 100 level.</p>
<p>The M.A. program may require more than one year of study. However, full-time students entering the program with appropriate background should complete the M.A. degree program within three consecutive calendar quarters after the student's first quarter of master's-level enrollment. The University allows no transfer units into the master's program. To provide a meaningful master's program within one year, advance planning of course work with an adviser is required. Requirements for the terminal master's program must be completed within three years.</p>
<h3><strong>Tracks within the M.A. Program</strong></h3>
<p>Students may pursue two different tracks in the Anthropology M.A. degree program. The tracks are not declarable in Axess; they do not appear on the transcript or the diploma. The tracks are:</p>
<ul><li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-program/graduate-program-tracks#arch">Archaeology</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-program/graduate-program-tracks#cs">Culture and Society</a></li>
</ul><p> </p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-4893361ff8f67a88ff3a578dcbef43bc">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>

  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jsa-layouts-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Graduate Program</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jsa_layouts-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-1215"><a href="/graduate-program" title="">Graduate Program Overview</a></li>

<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2822"><a href="/graduate-program/graduate-program-tracks">Tracks within Graduate Program</a></li>

<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2109"><a href="https://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;catalog=&amp;page=0&amp;q=ANTHRO&amp;filter-catalognumber-ANTHRO=on&amp;filt" title="menu link directs people to anthropology courses on Stanford Bulletin Explore Courses site">Courses</a></li>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Master Degree Program Year At-a-Glance </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-153" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-program/master-program/master-degree-program-year-glance" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Master Degree Program Year At-a-Glance" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><div class="at-a-glance">
<h3>AUTUMN</h3>
<p>	<strong>Courses:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Both Tracks-ANTHRO 310G Intro Grad Studies and ANTHRO 444 Colloquium</li>
<li>AR-None given</li>
<li>CS-ANTHRO 301A Foundations of Social Theory (optional for MA),  ANTHRO 306 Research Method (may waive out of requirement based on previous Methods training), and Anthro 400 Cultural &amp; Social Dissertation Writers Seminar</li>
</ul><p>	<strong>Funding:</strong></p>
<ul><li>non given</li>
</ul><p>	<strong>Milestones:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Approved Department's Plan of Study and Declaration of Track (form) due by the last day of the first week in Autumn quarter of first year Other</li>
</ul><p>	<strong>Requirements:</strong></p>
<ul><li>By the end of the first quarter, submit the Registrar's Masters Degree Program Proposal form</li>
<li>By the last day of the first quarter of the Masters degree program, submit the Department's Graduate Report of Degree Progress form</li>
</ul><p>	<strong>Units:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Full time 11-18 (15 minimum). Suggested: at least one or more department review courses (usually ANTHRO 300-level), ANTHRO 444 and 445, 310G, and a Theory course (usually ANTHRO 300-level) as required by track.</li>
</ul><p style="border-bottom:1px solid #a6a6a6"> </p>
<h3>WINTER</h3>
<p>	<strong>Courses:</strong></p>
<ul><li>All Tracks-ANTHRO 444 Colloquium</li>
<li>AR-ANTHRO 303 Intro Arch Theory</li>
<li>CS-ANTHRO 311G Intro CS Grad Studies and ANTHRO 301 Hist of Anth Theory</li>
<li>EE-ANTHRO 364 Eco Group (letter grade required)</li>
</ul><p>	<strong>Funding:</strong></p>
<ul><li>non given</li>
</ul><p>	<strong>Units:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Full time 11-18 (15 minimum). Suggested: at least one or more department review courses (usually ANTHRO 300-level), ANTHRO 444 and 445, 311G (required of the CS track students, only), and a Theory course (usually ANTHRO 300-level) as required by track.</li>
</ul><p>Central or Other Department: [Download department forms at <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references">Graduate Forms and References]</a></p>
<ul><li>Plan of Study and Declaration</li>
</ul><p>	Registrar:</p>
<ul><li>Masters Degree Program Proposal.  See <a href="https://stanford.app.box.com/v/progpropma" target="_blank">https://stanford.app.box.com/v/progpropma</a></li>
</ul><p style="border-bottom:1px solid #a6a6a6"> </p>
<h3>SPRING</h3>
<p>	<strong>Courses:</strong></p>
<ul><li>All Tracks-ANTHRO 444 Colloquium</li>
<li>AR-ANTHRO 303 Intro Arch Theory and ANTHRO 307 Arch Methods Res Des (or, by end 2nd year)</li>
<li>CS-ANTHRO 311G Intro CS Grad Studies and ANTHRO 300 Reading Theory Through Ethnography (optional for MA)</li>
<li>EE-ANTHRO 304 Data Analysis (or, by end 2nd year)</li>
</ul><p>	<strong>Funding:</strong></p>
<ul><li>non given</li>
</ul><p>	<strong>Other Requirements:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Completion of a minimum of 4 department review courses, inclusive of the theory course requirement, by the end of spring quarter (or the third quarter of matriculation as a graduate Masters student).</li>
<li>Completion of at least on Methods course by the end of spring quarter (or the third quarter of matriculation as a graduate Masters student).</li>
</ul><p>	<strong>Units:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Full time 11-18 (15 minimum). Suggested: at least one or more department review courses (usually ANTHRO 300-level), ANTHRO 444 and 445, 311G (required of the CS track students, only), and a Theory course (usually ANTHRO 300-level) as required by track.</li>
<li>Complete at least 45 units by the end of Spring quarter in the first year</li>
</ul><p> </p>
<p>	<strong>Forms:</strong></p>
<p>Central or Other Department:</p>
<ul><li>Tutorial IRB.  See <a href="https://humansubjects.stanford.edu/new/resources/training/citi.html" target="_blank">https://humansubjects.stanford.edu/new/resources/training/citi.html</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.citiprogram.org/" target="_blank">https://www.citiprogram.org/</a></li>
<li>Tutorial RCR.  See <a href="https://doresearch.stanford.edu/research-scholarship/responsible-conduct-research/responsible-conduct-research-training-faqs#citi-rcr-training" target="_blank">https://doresearch.stanford.edu/research-scholarship/responsible-conduct-research/responsible-conduct-research-training-faqs#citi-rcr-training</a></li>
</ul><p>	Registrar:</p>
<ul><li>Request to Graduate in AXESS by the Registrar Course Withdrawl deadline if graduating in the Spring quarter</li>
<li>Petition for Graduate Student Graduation Quarter.  See <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/registrar/files/grad_qtr.pdf" target="_blank">http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/registrar/files/grad_qtr.pdf</a></li>
<li>Application for Extension of Masters Degree Program.  See <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/registrar/files/appcandextens.pdf" target="_blank">http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/registrar/files/appcandextens.pdf</a></li>
<li>Request for Graduate Tuition Adjustment.  See <a href="https://stanford.app.box.com/v/tuitadjreq" target="_blank">https://stanford.app.box.com/v/tuitadjreq</a></li>
<li>Request for TGR Status.  See <a href="https://stanford.app.box.com/v/tgrreq" target="_blank">https://stanford.app.box.com/v/tgrreq</a></li>
</ul><p style="border-bottom:1px solid #a6a6a6"> </p>
<h3>SUMMER</h3>
<p>	<strong>Courses:</strong></p>
<ul><li>No enrollment required</li>
</ul><p>	<strong>Funding:</strong></p>
<ul><li>non given</li>
</ul><p>	<strong>Units:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Zero units; no enrollment required unless graduating in Summer Quarter</li>
</ul><p> </p>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>

            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Page Not Found  </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-79" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/node/79" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Page Not Found " class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h2>Please email the <a href="mailto:ebishop1@stanford.edu">webmaster</a> and describe how you got to this page.  Thank you.</h2>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->

  <div id="block-menu-block-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block plinks">     <h2>Main menu</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-1">

</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-mlid-2800 dropdown"><a href="/undergraduate-program" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Undergraduate Program <span class="caret"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-2850"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program" title="">Undergraduate Program Overview</a></li>

          <div class="row-fluid"><div class="region region-sidebar-first clearfix">
  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jsa-layouts-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Graduate Program</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jsa_layouts-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-1215"><a href="/graduate-program" title="">Graduate Program Overview</a></li>
<li class="expanded active-trail menu-mlid-1239 dropdown-submenu"><a href="/graduate-program/doctoral-program" title="" class="active-trail dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Doctoral Program</a><ul class="dropdown-menu"><li class="first leaf active-trail active menu-mlid-2500"><a href="/graduate-programs/about/doctoral-program/first-year-glance" class="active-trail active">First Year at-a-glance</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2504"><a href="/graduate-programs/about/doctoral-program/second-year-glance">Second Year at-a-glance</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2506"><a href="/graduate-program/about/doctoral-program/third-year-glance">Third Year at-a-glance</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2508"><a href="/graduate-program/about/doctoral-program/fourth-year-glance">Fourth Year at-a-glance</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2510"><a href="/graduate-program/about/doctoral-program/fifth-year-glance">Fifth Year at-a-glance</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2512"><a href="/graduate-program/about/doctoral-program/sixth-year-plus-glance">Sixth Year Plus at-a-glance</a></li>
<li class="last leaf menu-mlid-2502"><a href="/graduate-programs/about/doctoral-program/phd-minor-program">Ph.D. Minor Program</a></li>
</ul></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1245"><a href="/graduate-program/master-degree-program">Master Degree Program</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2822"><a href="/graduate-program/graduate-program-tracks">Tracks within Graduate Program</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1251"><a href="/graduate-program/graduate-admission">Admission</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2109"><a href="https://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;catalog=&amp;page=0&amp;q=ANTHRO&amp;filter-catalognumber-ANTHRO=on&amp;filt" title="menu link directs people to anthropology courses on Stanford Bulletin Explore Courses site">Courses</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-3142"><a href="/graduate-program/anthropology-graduate-student-organization">Graduate Student Organization</a></li>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> First Year PhD Program At-a-Glance </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-888" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-programs/about/doctoral-program/first-year-glance" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="First Year PhD Program At-a-Glance" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><div class="at-a-glance">
<h3>AUTUMN</h3>
<p><strong>Courses:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Both Tracks-ANTHRO 310G Intro Grad Studies</li>
<li>BothTracks-ANTHRO 444 Colloquium</li>
<li>AR-ANTHRO 303 Intro Arch Theory, ANTHRO 307 Arch Methods Res Des (or, by end 2nd year)</li>
<li>CS-ANTHRO 311G Intro CS Grad Studies, ANTHRO 300 Reading Theory Through Ethnography</li>
</ul><p><strong>Funding:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Fellowship stipend</li>
</ul><p><strong>Milestones:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Approved Plan of Study and Declaration of Track (form) due by the last day of the first week in Autumn quarter of first year</li>
</ul><p><strong>Other:</strong></p>
<ul><li>By the end of the first quarter, transfer in 45 or less previously completed graduate course units to the Ph.D. degree in Anthropology</li>
</ul><p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p>
<ul><li>One Extramural Funding Application on or by 15 May in Spring quarter of the first year (Note of Caution: please note that many if not all of the funding applications have deadlines mid Autumn quarter in the first year)</li>
<li>Review the Department Informed Agreement for Funding Support (form) (circulated at the beginning of the year)</li>
</ul><p><strong>Units:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Full time 11-18 (15 minimum). Suggested: at least one or more department review courses (usually ANTHRO 300-level), ANTHRO 444 and 445, 310G, and a Theory course (usually ANTHRO 300-level) as required by track.</li>
</ul><p><strong>Forms:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Central or Other: none</li>
<li>Department:
<ul><li>Plan of Study and Declaration</li>
<li>Doctoral Funding Information Reference which can be download at <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references">Graduate Forms and References</a></li>
</ul></li>
<li>Registrar:
<ul><li>Application for Graduate Residency Credit.  See <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/registrar/files/grad_res_credit.pdf" target="_blank">http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/registrar/files/grad_res_credit.pdf</a></li>
</ul></li>
</ul><p style="border-bottom:1px solid #a6a6a6"> </p>
<h3>WINTER</h3>
<p><strong>Courses:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Both Tracks-ANTHRO 444 Colloquium</li>
<li>AR-ANTHRO 303 Intro Arch Theory</li>
<li>CS-ANTHRO 311G Intro CS Grad Studies</li>
<li>ANTHRO 301A Foundations of Social Theory</li>
</ul><p><strong>Funding:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Fellowship stipend</li>
</ul><p><strong>Milestones:</strong></p>
<p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p>
<p><strong>Units:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Full time 11-18 (15 minimum). Suggested: at least one or more department review courses (usually ANTHRO 300-level), ANTHRO 444 and 445, 311G (required of the CS track students, only), and a Theory course (usually ANTHRO 300-level)as required by track.</li>
</ul><p><strong>Forms:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Central or Other: none</li>
<li>Department: none</li>
<li>Registrar: none</li>
</ul><p style="border-bottom:1px solid #a6a6a6"> </p>
<h3>SPRING</h3>
<p><strong>Courses:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Both Tracks-ANTHRO 444 Colloquium</li>
<li>AR-ANTHRO 303 Intro Arch Theory, ANTHRO 307 Arch Methods Res Des (or, by end 2nd year)</li>
<li>CS-ANTHRO 311G Intro CS Grad Studies, ANTHRO 300 Reading Theory Through Ethnography</li>
</ul><p><strong>Funding:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Fellowship stipend</li>
</ul><p><strong>Milestones:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Approved Pre-dissertation Proposal for summer field research on or by 15 May in Spring quarter of the first year.</li>
</ul><p><strong>Optional:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Submit the Department Request for Incidental funding on or by 15 June in the first year.</li>
<li>Submit a Graduate Authorization Petition Requesting the MA on the Way to the Ph.D. on or by 15 May in Spring quarter of the first year.</li>
</ul><p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Submit the First-year Summer Funding Program Petition on or by 15 May in Spring quarter of the first year.</li>
<li>Complete Ethics training during the department-sponsored workshop during Winter quarter in the first year.</li>
<li>Complete CITI Tutorial for both IRB and RCR on or by 15 May in Spring quarter of the first year.</li>
<li>Submit Graduate Report of Degree Progress and Research Proposal on or by 15 May in SPring quarter of the first year.</li>
<li>Request a Determination of Status for Non-medical Human Subjects Research Protocol; or, submit a Non-medical</li>
<li>Human Subjects Protocol on or by 15 May in Spring quarter of the first year.</li>
<li>Complete three or six department review courses by end spring quarter with a minimum letter grade of 'B+' by the end of Spring quarter in the first year.</li>
<li>Confirm Faculty Advisor on or by 15 May in Spring quarter of the first year.</li>
</ul><p><strong>Units:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Full time 11-18 (15 minimum). Suggested: at least one or more department review courses (usually ANTHRO 300-level), ANTHRO 444 and 445, 311G (required of the CS track students, only), and a Theory course (usually ANTHRO 300-level) as required by track</li>
<li>Complete at least 45 units by the end of Spring quarter in the first year</li>
</ul><p><strong>Forms:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Central or Other:
<ul><li>IRB Determination of Status.  See <a href="http://researchcompliance.stanford.edu/hs/new/resources/forms_templates/nonmedical.html" target="_blank">http://researchcompliance.stanford.edu/hs/new/resources/forms_templates/nonmedical.html</a></li>
<li>Tutorial IRB.  See <a href="https://humansubjects.stanford.edu/new/resources/training/citi.html" target="_blank">https://humansubjects.stanford.edu/new/resources/training/citi.html, </a><a href="https://www.citiprogram.org/" target="_blank">https://www.citiprogram.org/</a></li>
<li>Tutorial RCR.  See <a href="https://doresearch.stanford.edu/research-scholarship/responsible-conduct-research/responsible-conduct-research-training-faqs#citi-rcr-training" target="_blank">https://doresearch.stanford.edu/research-scholarship/responsible-conduct-research/responsible-conduct-research-training-faqs#citi-rcr-training</a></li>
</ul></li>
<li>Department: [Download department forms at <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references" target="_blank">Graduate Forms and References</a>]
<ul><li>Graduate Report of Degree Progress </li>
<li>First-year Summer Funding Program Petition</li>
<li>Request for Incidental Funding</li>
<li>Department funding support</li>
</ul></li>
</ul><ul><li>Registrar:
<ul><li>Graduate Authorization Petition.  See <a href="https://axess.stanford.edu/" target="_blank">https://axess.stanford.edu/</a></li>
<li>Masters Degree Program Proposal.  See <a href="https://stanford.app.box.com/v/progpropma" target="_blank">https://stanford.app.box.com/v/progpropma</a></li>
</ul></li>
</ul><p style="border-bottom:1px solid #a6a6a6"> </p>
<h3>SUMMER</h3>
<p><strong>Courses:</strong></p>
<ul><li>No enrollment required</li>
</ul><p><strong>Funding:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Funding based on eligibility by application, only</li>
</ul><p><strong>Milestones:</strong></p>
<p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Submit a Report of Pre-dissertation research completion to Advisor on or by 15 Septemebr in Summer quarter of the first year</li>
</ul><p><strong>Units:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Zero units; no enrollment required</li>
</ul><p><strong>Forms:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Central or Other: none</li>
<li>Department: Report of (Pre)dissertation Research Completion (email message format)</li>
<li>Registrar: none</li>
</ul><p> </p>
<p> </p>
</div>
<p> </p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>

<meta name="description" content="To request the Ph.D. Minor a prospective Minor should do take the following steps in the order detailed below. Identify a Minor advisor from the Department of Anthropology (Minor department) tenured or tenure-track faculty. Confirm a timeline for the Minor degree requirements (below); and, for the Minor advisor participation in both the Oral examination and Dissertation Reading committees. Submit the Application for Ph.D." />

  <div id="block-menu-block-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block plinks">     <h2>Main menu</h2>

          <div class="row-fluid"><div class="region region-sidebar-first clearfix">
  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jsa-layouts-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Graduate Program</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jsa_layouts-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-1215"><a href="/graduate-program" title="">Graduate Program Overview</a></li>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> PhD Minor Program </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-890" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-programs/about/doctoral-program/phd-minor-program" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="PhD Minor Program" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>To request the Ph.D. Minor a prospective Minor should do take the following steps in the order detailed below. Identify a Minor advisor from the Department of Anthropology (Minor department) tenured or tenure-track faculty. Confirm a timeline for the Minor degree requirements (below); and, for the Minor advisor participation in both the Oral examination and Dissertation Reading committees. Submit the <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/registrar/files/app_phd_minor.pdf">Application for Ph.D. Minor</a> to the Department for Anthropology (Minor department) for signature to initiate a request for the Minor. Once signed, submit the application to the doctoral degree program Home department for signature and processing. The <a href="http://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/registrar/files/appcanddoct.pdf">Application for Candidacy for Doctoral Degree</a> should be submitted to the Home department at the time one hands in the Minor application, as well. Please copy the Minor department on the approved Candidacy form. Finally, submit a helpsu to the University registrar for confirmation of the Ph.D. Minor to the student record.</p>
<p>The requirements for a Ph.D. Minor in the Department of Anthropology include the milestones and course/unit requirements listed below. A Ph.D. Minor in the department of Anthropology must complete a minimum of 30 units of ANTHRO subject code courses at the 300 level, each course should be completed with a minimum (GPA) of 3.0 (B). The Minor must enlist an ANTHRO faculty member who will provide written consent to serve as the adviser for the Ph.D. Minor as well as to serve on the student's Oral examination and Dissertation Reading committees. With the ANTHRO faculty adviser, the Ph.D. Minor determines a coherent plan of study and submits the <a href="https://www.stanford.edu/dept/anthropology/cgi-bin/web/?q=system/files/ANTHROEnteringPhDFirstYearCohort_PlanofStudy_1128.pdf">Plan of Study Form</a> with the Application for Ph.D. Minor to the Student Services Officer in the Department of Anthropology to initiate a request for the Minor. The Minor must pass, with a minimum grade of 'B+', three ANTHRO theory courses, and one ANTHRO course in a geographical or theoretical area. The completion of the course of study for the Ph.D. Minor must be confirmed before submitting the Request for Terminal Graduate Registration to the doctoral degree program home department.</p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>

  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-c9efc1b4c07a532f935329286864b6be">

          <div class="row-fluid"><div class="region region-sidebar-first clearfix">
  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jsa-layouts-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Graduate Program</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jsa_layouts-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-1215"><a href="/graduate-program" title="">Graduate Program Overview</a></li>
<li class="expanded active-trail menu-mlid-1239 dropdown-submenu"><a href="/graduate-program/doctoral-program" title="" class="active-trail dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Doctoral Program</a><ul class="dropdown-menu"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-2500"><a href="/graduate-programs/about/doctoral-program/first-year-glance">First Year at-a-glance</a></li>
<li class="leaf active-trail active menu-mlid-2504"><a href="/graduate-programs/about/doctoral-program/second-year-glance" class="active-trail active">Second Year at-a-glance</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2506"><a href="/graduate-program/about/doctoral-program/third-year-glance">Third Year at-a-glance</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2508"><a href="/graduate-program/about/doctoral-program/fourth-year-glance">Fourth Year at-a-glance</a></li>

<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2512"><a href="/graduate-program/about/doctoral-program/sixth-year-plus-glance">Sixth Year Plus at-a-glance</a></li>

</ul></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1245"><a href="/graduate-program/master-degree-program">Master Degree Program</a></li>

<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2109"><a href="https://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;catalog=&amp;page=0&amp;q=ANTHRO&amp;filter-catalognumber-ANTHRO=on&amp;filt" title="menu link directs people to anthropology courses on Stanford Bulletin Explore Courses site">Courses</a></li>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Second Year PhD Program At-a-Glance </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-892" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/graduate-programs/about/doctoral-program/second-year-glance" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Second Year PhD Program At-a-Glance" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><div class="at-a-glance">
<h3>AUTUMN</h3>
<p><strong>Courses:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Both Tracks-ANTHRO 444 Colloquium</li>
<li>AR-</li>
<li>CS-ANTHRO 306 Research Methods</li>
</ul><p><strong>Funding:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Fellowship; or, Teaching Assistantship</li>
</ul><p><strong>Optional:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Submit the Department Request for Incidental funding on or by 15 June in the first year.</li>
</ul><div><strong>Milestones:</strong></div>
<ul><li>At least one Teaching Assistantship Assignment in any quarter</li>
</ul><p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Attend the CTL Teaching Workshop on the Friday before the first day of Autumn quarter in the second year.</li>
<li>Attend the ANTHRO Teaching Workshop during the first week of Autumn quarter in the second year.</li>
<li>Complete Sexual Harrassment Training on or by the last day of the first week in Autumn quarter of the first year.</li>
<li>Review the Department Informed Agreement for Funding Support</li>
</ul><p><strong>Units:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Full time 11-18 (15 minimum); or, 10 units, only, if serving as a Teaching Assistant with assistantship/salary funding.</li>
<li>Suggested: at least one or more department review courses (usually ANTHRO 300-level), ANTHRO 444 and 445, and a</li>
<li>Methods course (usually ANTHRO 300-level) as required by track, and/or Area (Language) course.</li>
</ul><p><strong>Forms:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Central or Other:
<ul><li>Sexual Harassement Training Module.  See <a href="http://harass.stanford.edu/non-supe_training.html" target="_blank">http://harass.stanford.edu/non-supe_training.html</a></li>
</ul></li>
<li>Department: [Download department forms at <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references">Graduate Forms and References</a>]
<ul><li>Department Informed Agreement for Funding Support</li>
<li>TA Reference</li>
<li>Request for Incidental Funding</li>
</ul></li>
</ul><p style="border-bottom:1px solid #a6a6a6"> </p>
<h3>WINTER</h3>
<p><strong>Courses:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Both Tracks-ANTHRO 444 Colloquium</li>
</ul><p><strong>Funding:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Fellowship; or, Teachign Assistantship</li>
</ul><p><strong>Milestones:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Fulfill the Department Language Requirement on or by the first day of finals weekin Witner quarter of the second year.</li>
<li>Petition for Candidacy on or by the first day of finals week in Winter quarter of the second year.</li>
</ul><p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Confirm the Qualifying Examination Committee Member Advisors for Area and Topic on or by the first day of finals week in Winter quarter of the second year.</li>
</ul><p><strong>Units:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Full time 11-18 (15 minimum); or, 10 units, only, if serving as a Teaching Assistant with assistantship/salary funding.</li>
<li>Suggested: at least one or more department review courses (usually ANTHRO 300-level), ANTHRO 444 and 445, and a</li>
<li>Methods course (usually ANTHRO 300-level) as required by track, and/or Area (Language) course</li>
</ul><p><strong>Forms:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Central or Other:</li>
<li>Department: [Download department forms at <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references">Graduate Forms and References</a>]
<ul><li>Language requirement (petition)</li>
<li>Report of Qualifying Examination Status form</li>
</ul></li>
<li>Registrar: Petition for Candidacy PhD. See <a href="https://stanford.app.box.com/v/appcanddoct" target="_blank">https://stanford.app.box.com/v/appcanddoct</a></li>
</ul><p style="border-bottom:1px solid #a6a6a6"> </p>
<h3>SPRING</h3>
<p><strong>Courses:</strong></p>
<ul><li>All Tracks-ANTHRO 444 Colloquium</li>
<li>AR-</li>
<li>CS-ANTHRO 308 Proposal Writing</li>
</ul><p><strong>Funding:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Fellowship; or, Teaching Assistantship</li>
</ul><div><strong>Milestones:</strong></div>
<div><strong>Requirements:</strong></div>
<ul><li>Evidence of Proposal Writing Training on or by the last day of Spring quarter in the second year.</li>
<li>Evidence of Research Methods Training on or by the last day of Spring quarter in the second year.</li>
<li>Submit Graduate Report of Degree Progress and Research Proposal on or by 15 May in Spring quarter of the second year.</li>
<li>Request a Determination of Status for Non-medical Human Subjects Research Protocol; or, submit a Non-medical Human Subjects Protocol on or by 15 May in Spring quarter of the</li>
<li>Complete six or six department review courses by end spring quarter in the second year with a minimum letter grade of 'B+'</li>
<li>Complete a Field Check-out Meeting before departure from the Bay Area for the field with the Student Services Officer (usually on or by 15 June in Spring quarter of the second year).</li>
</ul><p><strong>Units:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Full time 11-18 (15 minimum); or, 10 units, only, if serving as a Teaching Assistant with assistantship/salary funding.</li>
<li>Suggested: at least one or more department review courses (usually ANTHRO 300-level), ANTHRO 444 and 445, a Methods course (usually ANTHRO 300-level) as required by track and a Proposal Writing course (usually ANTHRO 300-level) as required by track</li>
</ul><p><strong>Forms:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Central or Other:
<ul><li>IRB Determination of Status.  See <a href="http://researchcompliance.stanford.edu/hs/new/resources/forms_templates/nonmedical.html" target="_blank">http://researchcompliance.stanford.edu/hs/new/resources/forms_templates/nonmedical.html</a></li>
<li>Protocol Submission.  See <a href="https://www.citiprogram.org/" target="_blank">https://www.citiprogram.org/</a> and <a href="https://eprotocol.stanford.edu/" target="_blank">https://eprotocol.stanford.edu/</a></li>
</ul></li>
<li>Department: [Download department forms at <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/graduate-forms-and-references">Graduate Forms and References</a>]
<ul><li>Graduate Report of Degree Progress</li>
<li>Field Check-out</li>
<li>Graduate Student Informed Agreement for</li>
<li>Department Funding Support</li>
</ul></li>
<li>Registrar:</li>
</ul><p style="border-bottom:1px solid #a6a6a6"> </p>
<h3>SUMMER</h3>
<p><strong>Courses:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Both Tracks ANTHRO 450 Research Apprenticeship</li>
</ul><p><strong>Funding:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Pre-doctoral Research Affiliateship</li>
</ul><p><strong>Milestones:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Receive Candidacy by end of Second year PhD</li>
</ul><p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Submit a Report of Pre-dissertation research completion to Advisor on or by 15 September in Summer quarter of the second year.</li>
<li>Complete at least 50 units on or by the last day of Spring quarter in the Second year.</li>
</ul><p><strong>Units:</strong></p>
<ul><li>10 units, only. Enroll in ANTHRO 450 Research Apprenticeship</li>
</ul><p><strong>Forms:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Department: Report of (Pre)dissertation Research Completion (email message format)</li>
</ul><p> </p>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>

                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Page Not Found  </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-79" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/node/79" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Page Not Found " class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h2>Please email the <a href="mailto:ebishop1@stanford.edu">webmaster</a> and describe how you got to this page.  Thank you.</h2>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>

          <!-- /#content-wrap -->
        </div>

              </div>

  </div>

          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Page Not Found  </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-79" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/node/79" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Page Not Found " class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h2>Please email the <a href="mailto:ebishop1@stanford.edu">webmaster</a> and describe how you got to this page.  Thank you.</h2>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>

        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>

            <div id="main-content" class="row main-content">
                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Anthropology Undergraduate Program </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-970" class="node node-stanford-landing-page stanford-4-col-header clearfix" about="/undergraduate-program" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Anthropology Undergraduate Program" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-landing-page-item field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div  about="/field-collection/field-landing-page-item/268" typeof="" class="ds-1col entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-landing-page-item view-mode-stanford_4_col_header clearfix">

  
  <div class="well"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>Mission</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-description field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/mission-and-learning-outcomes"><img length="88" src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/campus-scene13_0.jpg" width="250" class="img-frame" /></a></p>
<p style="padding-left:7px;">Our mission is to provide undergraduates with instruction in anthropology and a program of work leading to the bachelor's degree.</p>
</div></div></div><div class="more-link"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/mission-and-learning-outcomes">About</a></div></div></div></div></div></div>

</div><div class="field-item odd"><div  about="/field-collection/field-landing-page-item/298" typeof="" class="ds-1col entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-landing-page-item view-mode-stanford_4_col_header clearfix">

  
  <div class="well"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>Degree Emphases</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-description field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/anthropology-degree-emphasis"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/campus-scene12_0.jpg" width="250" length="88" class="img-frame" /></a></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:5px; padding-left:7px;">The department offers the following four emphases:<br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/degree-emphasis/culture-and-society-emphasis">» Culture and Society </a><br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/degree-emphasis/ecology-environment-and-evolution">» Ecology, Environment, and Evolution</a><br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/degree-emphasis/medical-anthropology">» Medical Anthropology</a><br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/degree-emphasis/self-designed-emphasis">» a Self-designed emphasis</a></p>
</div></div></div><div class="more-link"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/anthropology-degree-emphasis">Degree Emphases</a></div></div></div></div></div></div>

</div><div class="field-item even"><div  about="/field-collection/field-landing-page-item/270" typeof="" class="ds-1col entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-landing-page-item view-mode-stanford_4_col_header clearfix">

  
  <div class="well"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>Degree Requirements</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-description field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/major"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/campus-scene1.jpg" width="250" length="88" class="img-frame" /></a></p>
<p style="padding-left:7px;">Undergraduate training in the department of Anthropology is designed for students who seek the bachelor of arts (B.A.) degree.  Students can also declare Anthropology as a minor.<br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/major">» Major</a><br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/minor">» Minor</a></p>
</div></div></div><div class="more-link"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/major">https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/major</a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-2nd-links field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/major">Major</a></div><div class="field-item odd"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/minor">Minor</a></div></div></div></div></div></div>

</div><div class="field-item odd"><div  about="/field-collection/field-landing-page-item/272" typeof="" class="ds-1col entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-landing-page-item view-mode-stanford_4_col_header clearfix">

  
  <div class="well"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>How to Declare</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-description field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/how-declare/major"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/campus-scene7.jpg" width="250" length="88" class="img-frame" /></a></p>
<p style="padding-left:7px;">See steps to declare anthropology as your major or minor:<br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/how-declare/major">» Major</a><br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/how-declare/minor">» Minor</a></p>
</div></div></div><div class="more-link"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/how-declare/major">https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/how-declare/major</a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-2nd-links field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/how-declare/major">Major</a></div><div class="field-item odd"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/how-declare/minor">Minor</a></div></div></div></div></div></div>

</div><div class="field-item even"><div  about="/field-collection/field-landing-page-item/276" typeof="" class="ds-1col entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-landing-page-item view-mode-stanford_4_col_header clearfix">

  
  <div class="well"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>Honors Program</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-description field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/honors"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/campus-scene2.jpg" width="250" length="88" class="img-frame" /></a></p>
<p style="padding-left:7px;">The Honors Program and Senior Paper option in Anthropology provides majors the opportunity to conduct original research under the guidance of an Anthropology faculty member.<br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/honors#honors-programr">» Honors Program Overview </a><br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/recommended-timeline">» Recommended Timeline</a><br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/honors-program-and-senior-paper/research-funding">» Available Funding </a><br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/honors-program-and-senior-paper/additional-resources">» Additional Resources </a></p>
</div></div></div><div class="more-link"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/honors">https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/honors</a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-2nd-links field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/honors#honors-program">Honors Program</a></div><div class="field-item odd"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/honors#senior-paper">Senior Paper</a></div></div></div></div></div></div>

</div><div class="field-item odd"><div  about="/field-collection/field-landing-page-item/278" typeof="" class="ds-1col entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-landing-page-item view-mode-stanford_4_col_header clearfix">

  
  <div class="well"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>Research Opportunities</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-description field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/research-opportunities"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/campus-scene8.jpg" width="250" length="88" class="img-frame" /></a></p>
<p style="padding-left:7px;">The Department of Anthropology offers a variety of field school, summer research, and travel research opportunities.<br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/research/excavation-site-opportunities-field-schools">» Field School </a><br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/research/summer-research-opportunities-funding">» Summer Research Program </a><br /><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/research/travel-research-opportunities">» Travel Research Program </a></p>
</div></div></div><div class="more-link"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/research-opportunities">https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/research-opportunities</a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-2nd-links field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/research/excavation-site-opportunities-field-schools">Field School</a></div><div class="field-item odd"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/research/summer-research-opportunities-funding">Summer Research Opportunities</a></div><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/research/travel-research-opportunities">Travel Research Opportunities</a></div></div></div></div></div></div>

</div><div class="field-item even"><div  about="/field-collection/field-landing-page-item/280" typeof="" class="ds-1col entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-landing-page-item view-mode-stanford_4_col_header clearfix">

  
  <div class="well"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>Forms and References</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-description field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/undergraduate-forms-and-references"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/campus-scene5.jpg" width="250" length="88" class="img-frame" /></a></p>
<p style="padding-left:7px;">Download various undergraduate forms and reference documents.</p>
</div></div></div><div class="more-link"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/department/forms-and-documents/undergraduate-forms-and-references">Undergrad Forms and References</a></div></div></div></div></div></div>

</div><div class="field-item odd"><div  about="/field-collection/field-landing-page-item/282" typeof="" class="ds-1col entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-landing-page-item view-mode-stanford_4_col_header clearfix">

  
  <div class="well"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>Courses</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-description field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;catalog=&amp;page=0&amp;q=ANTHRO&amp;filter-catalognumber-ANTHRO=on&amp;filt"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/campus-scene11.jpg" width="250" length="88" class="img-frame" /></a></p>
<p style="padding-left:7px;">Anthropology courses cover a wide range of topics and area studies within the field such as sociocultural anthropology, ecology, evolution, linguistics, medical anthropology, political economy, environmental anthropology, science and technology, and archaeology.”</p>
</div></div></div><div class="more-link"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;catalog=&amp;page=0&amp;q=ANTHRO&amp;filter-catalognumber-ANTHRO=on&amp;filt">Courses</a></div></div></div></div></div></div>

</div><div class="field-item even"><div  about="/field-collection/field-landing-page-item/284" typeof="" class="ds-1col entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-landing-page-item view-mode-stanford_4_col_header clearfix">

  
  <div class="well"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>Peer Advisor</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-description field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/peer-advisors"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/campus-scene4.jpg" width="250" length="88" class="img-frame" /></a></p>
<p style="padding-left:7px;">Peer advisors serve as a resource to undergraduate students for questions about course planning, departmental policies, declaration process, and events.</p>
</div></div></div><div class="more-link"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/peer-advisors">Peer Advisors</a></div></div></div></div></div></div>

</div><div class="field-item odd"><div  about="/field-collection/field-landing-page-item/286" typeof="" class="ds-1col entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-landing-page-item view-mode-stanford_4_col_header clearfix">

  
  <div class="well"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>Undergrad Journal</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-description field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/ug-research-journal"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/campus-scene3.jpg" width="250" length="88" class="img-frame" /></a></p>
<p style="padding-left:7px;"><em>CONTEXT: Undergraduate Research Journal in Anthropology</em> is an annual publication comprised of scholarly articles and reviews written by Stanford undergraduates from all academic backgrounds</p>
</div></div></div><div class="more-link"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/ug-research-journal">Undergrad Research Journal</a></div></div></div></div></div></div>

</div><div class="field-item even"><div  about="/field-collection/field-landing-page-item/274" typeof="" class="ds-1col entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-landing-page-item view-mode-stanford_4_col_header clearfix">

  
  <div class="well"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>Coterm Master&#039;s Program</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-description field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-program/admissions/coterminal"><img length="88" src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/campus-scene6.jpg" width="250" class="img-frame" /></a></p>
<p style="padding-left:7px;">The Coterminal Master’s degree program allows Stanford undergraduates to study for a master’s degree while completing their bachelor’s degree(s). Students with strong academic records may apply for admission to a coterminal master’s program upon completion of 120 units.</p>
</div></div></div><div class="more-link"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/graduate-program/admissions/coterminal">Coterm Masters</a></div></div></div></div></div></div>

</div><div class="field-item odd"><div  about="/field-collection/field-landing-page-item/288" typeof="" class="ds-1col entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-landing-page-item view-mode-stanford_4_col_header clearfix">

  
  <div class="well"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>Admissions</h2></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-description field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="http://admission.stanford.edu/"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/campus-scene10.jpg" width="250" length="88" class="img-frame" /></a></p>
<p style="padding-left:7px;">Undergrad admissions website </p>
</div></div></div><div class="more-link"><div class="field field-name-field-s-lp-item-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://admission.stanford.edu/">Stanford undergraduate admission website</a></div></div></div></div></div></div>

</div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>

<li>Schedule a meeting: <a href="http://meetme.so/anahids" target="_blank">http://meetme.so/anahids</a></li>
<li>Office: <a href="https://www.google.com/maps/search/main+quad+building+50/@37.4272072,-122.1711705,18z/data=!3m1!4b1" target="_blank">Building 50, 51N</a>.</li>

<div id="block-menu-menu-footer-people-menu" class="clearfix block block-menu span2">     <h2>People</h2>
      <div class="content"> <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/people/faculty" title="">Faculty</a></li>

<li class="leaf"><a href="/undergraduate-program/peer-advisors" title="">Undergrad Peer Advisors</a></li>
<li class="last leaf"><a href="/people/staff">Staff</a></li>
</ul> </div>
</div>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Anthropology Degree Emphasis </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-974" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/undergraduate-program/anthropology-degree-emphasis" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Anthropology Degree Emphasis" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>The department offers the following four emphasis:</p>
<h3>Culture and Society</h3>
<p>The scope of cultural and social anthropology at Stanford includes the study of the full range of human societies and cultures, especially as these are drawn together in transnational and global interactions. The track has a focus on understanding a wide range of issues in the comparative study of society and culture. <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/degree-emphasis/culture-and-society-emphasis">Read More »</a></p>
<h3>Ecology, Environment, and Evolution</h3>
<p>Environment and Ecology track focuses on the dynamic relationship between the human organism and its natural and social environment. The track provides a cross-disciplinary, theoretical approach to the ecology of human-environmental dynamics, including behavioral ecology, political ecology, evolutionary ecology, zooarchaeology and ethnoarchaeology, the human dimensions of global change, demography, biological anthropology, and human population ecology. <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/degree-emphasis/ecology-environment-and-evolution">Read More »</a></p>
<h3>Medical Anthropology</h3>
<p>Medical anthropology is the study of how health and illness are shaped, experienced, and understood in light of global, historical, and political forces. It is one of the most exciting subfields of anthropology and has increasingly clear relevance for students and professionals interested in the complexity of disease states, diagnostic categories, and what comes to count as pathology or health. <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/degree-emphasis/medical-anthropology">Read More »</a></p>
<h3>Self-Designed Emphasis</h3>
<p>Students in the self-designed emphasis will work with their faculty advisor to discuss their emphasis interests and ideas in order to design an approved plan of study. This plan of study may include core emphasis courses from the Culture and Society, EEE, or Medical Anthropology fields. <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/degree-emphasis/self-designed-emphasis">Read More »</a></p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
