                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Checklist and Timeline for Honors Candidates </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-966" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/undergraduate-program/recommended-timeline" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Checklist and Timeline for Honors Candidates" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h2><strong>Junior Year</strong></h2>
<table>Checklist and Timeline for Junior Year
	<tbody><tr><td>
				<p><strong>Autumn </strong></p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p><strong>Winter </strong></p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p><strong>Spring </strong></p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p><strong>Summer</strong></p>
			</td>
		</tr><tr><td>
				<p>Meet with Faculty Advisor to explore and discuss research ideas and themes. Develop a research proposal.</p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p>Submit Honors Program Application no later than February 15<sup>th</sup> to the Undergraduate Student Services Officer. Apply undergraduate research grants through the Department of Anthropology and UAR. Apply for Honors via Axess.</p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p>Ensure all documentation for travel and funding (if awarded) is completed and submitted to the Undergraduate Student Services Officer. Detailed instructions will be sent to students upon acceptance into the Honors Program.</p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p>Conduct research and maintain communication with Honors Advisor and department staff with regards to changes and updates.</p>
			</td>
		</tr><tr><td>
				<p><strong>Required Enrollment: </strong>none</p>
				<p> </p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p><strong>Required Enrollment: </strong>none</p>
				<p> </p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p><strong>Required Enrollment: </strong>ANTHRO 93: Pre-field Research Seminar (offered in Spring Quarter only).</p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p><strong>Required Enrollment: </strong>none</p>
				<p> </p>
			</td>
		</tr><tr><td>
				<p><strong>Recommended Enrollment:</strong> ANTHRO 92A or 92B: Undergraduate Research Proposal Writing Workshop.</p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p><strong>Recommended Enrollment:</strong> ANTHRO 92A or 92B: Undergraduate Research Proposal Writing Workshop.</p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p><strong>Recommended Enrollment:</strong> NA</p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p><strong>Recommended Enrollment:</strong> Bing Honors College, 3 weeks in early September prior to Autumn Quarter.</p>
			</td>
		</tr></tbody></table><h2><br /><strong>Senior Year </strong></h2>
<table>Chicklist and Timeline for Senior Year
	<tbody><tr><td>
				<p><strong>Autumn </strong></p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p><strong>Winter </strong></p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p><strong>Spring </strong></p>
			</td>
		</tr><tr><td>
				<p>By November 15<sup>th</sup>, submit a draft outline to your Honors Advisor (1st reader) to allow adequate review time. Schedule a meeting with your Honors Advisor well in advance of the November 15th deadline to allow time to incorporate feedback into the final outline.</p>
				<p>Select a 2nd reader prior to Winter Quarter.</p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p>By January 31<sup>st</sup>, submit a draft (including literature review, bibliography, and table of contents) to your Honors Advisor to allow sufficient time to review provide suggestions. Honors candidates should schedule a meeting with their Honors Advisor to review feedback and revisions. </p>
				<p> </p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p>By April 4<sup>th</sup>, submit preliminary draft to honors advisor (1st reader). Honors candidates are responsible for scheduling an appointment with their 1st reader to receive feedback on the preliminary draft to allow sufficient time for necessary revisions.<br /><br />
					By May 13<sup>th</sup>, submit the final draft of Honors Research Paper to your Honors Advisor (1st Reader), and 2nd reader. Include The Honors Paper Signature Sheet and a copy of the honors program requirements as listed on the application when submitting final paper to the readers.  <br />
					 </p>
				<p>By May 20th, your Honors Advisor and 2nd reader must approve your research paper by signing off on the Honors Paper Signature Sheet. The Signature Sheet must include signatures from your Honors Advisor and 2<sup>nd</sup> reader and submitted to the Undergraduate Student Services Officer no later than May 20th. If a student does not receive a grade of “A-“or better on their paper, they must remove their Honors request via Axess.</p>
			</td>
		</tr><tr><td>
				<p><strong>Required Enrollment:</strong> none</p>
				<p> </p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p><strong>Required Enrollment:</strong> none</p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p><strong>Required Enrollment:</strong> ANTHRO 95B for a minimum of 5 units. You must earn an A- or better to qualify for Honors.</p>
				<p> </p>
			</td>
		</tr><tr><td>
				<p><strong>Recommended Enrollment:</strong><br />
					ANTHRO 94: Post-field Research Seminar (offered in Autumn quarter only).</p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p><strong>Recommended Enrollment:</strong><br />
					ANTHRO 199: Senior and Master's Paper Writing Workshop and/or ANTHRO 95: Research in Anthropology</p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p><strong>Recommended Enrollment: </strong>NA</p>
			</td>
		</tr></tbody></table><p> </p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-7ac236174090d7f9650f3e4c5406b41e">

        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>

      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">

          <div class="row-fluid"><div class="region region-sidebar-first clearfix">
  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jsa-layouts-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Undergraduate Program</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jsa_layouts-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-2850"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program" title="">Undergraduate Program Overview</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2518"><a href="/undergraduate-program/mission-and-learning-outcomes">Mission and Learning Outcomes</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-2784"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/major" title="">Degree Requirements</a></li>

<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1227"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/how-declare" title="">How to Declare</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-1223"><a href="/undergraduate-program/honors">Honors Program</a></li>
<li class="expanded active-trail active menu-mlid-1229 dropdown-submenu"><a href="/undergraduate-program/research-opportunities" class="active-trail dropdown-toggle active" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Research Opportunities</a><ul class="dropdown-menu"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-2127"><a href="/undergraduate-program/research/excavation-site-opportunities-field-schools" title="">Field Schools (Çatalhöyük)</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-2808"><a href="/undergraduate-program/research/summer-research-opportunities-funding">Summer Research Opportunities &amp; Funding</a></li>
<li class="last leaf menu-mlid-2131"><a href="/undergraduate-program/research/travel-research-opportunities" title="">Travel Research Opportunities (Sophomore College)</a></li>
</ul></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-1233"><a href="/department/forms-and-documents/undergraduate-forms-and-references" title="">UG Forms and References</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2133"><a href="https://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;catalog=&amp;page=0&amp;q=ANTHRO&amp;filter-catalognumber-ANTHRO=on&amp;filt" title="">Courses</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-1231"><a href="/undergraduate-program/peer-advisors">Peer Advisors</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-1235"><a href="/undergraduate-program/ug-research-journal">UG Research Journal</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-1225"><a href="/graduate-program/admissions/coterminal">Coterminal Masters</a></li>
<li class="last leaf menu-mlid-2135"><a href="http://admission.stanford.edu/" title="Information regarding undergraduate admissions at Stanford University">Admission</a></li>
</ul></div>
 </div>
</div>
</div>
 <!-- /.region -->
</div>
        </div>
        <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Research Opportunities </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-95" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/undergraduate-program/research-opportunities" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Research Opportunities" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>The Department of Anthropology offers a variety of field school, summer research, and travel research opportunities.</p>
<h4>Field school opportunities</h4>
<ul><li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/research/excavation-site-opportunities-field-schools">Çatalhöyük</a></li>
</ul><h4><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/research/summer-research-opportunities-funding" style="color:#000; font-weight:600;text-shadow:none;">Summer Research Opportunities &amp; Funding opportunities</a></h4>
<ul><li><a href="http://web.stanford.edu/group/beagle2/index.html" target="_blank">Beagle II Award</a></li>
<li><a href="http://web.stanford.edu/group/hopes/cgi-bin/hopes_test/about-2/" target="_blank">Hopes</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/research-opportunities/summer-research-opportunities-funding/chavin/">Chavín de Huántar</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/research-opportunities/summer-research-opportunities-funding/franz-boas-summer-scholars">Franz Boas Summer Scholars</a></li>
<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/research-opportunities/summer-research-opportunities-funding/michelle-z">Michelle Z. Rosaldo Summer Field Research Grant</a></li>
<li>Tambopata (not offered in 2017)</li>
</ul><h4>Travel Research Opportunities</h4>
<ul><li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/research/travel-research-opportunities">Sophomore College Course and Field Seminar</a></li>
</ul><h4>Eligibility and Selection Criteria</h4>
<p>Please note that application materials, eligibility and selection criteria are different for each fellowship; these are also subject to change each academic year.</p>
<h4>Application Process</h4>
<p>See <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/undergraduate-forms-and-references">FORMS</a> to download an application. Please refer to the application for deadline and contact information.</p>
<p> </p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-1e94b687585b621e268797ba2e6be831">

        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">

    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Chavín de Huántar  </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-982" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/undergraduate-program/research-opportunities/summer-research-opportunities-funding/chavin" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Chavín de Huántar " class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p><img alt="" class="image-large-scaled" height="244" src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/large-scaled/public/chavin_0.jpg?itok=XudpcAJL" width="161" style="float:left; padding-right:20px;" /></p>
<p>Chavín de Huántar is a 3000-year-old monumental temple site located in the north-central Andes of Peru, sandwiched between the desert coast - one of the dryest deserts of the world - and the humid tropical Amazonian lowlands to the east. Chavin is ancestral to the famed Andean prehistoric states, culminating with the expansive Inca empire, which were primarily situated in coastal and sierra environments.</p>
<p>The primary goal of the project is to accurately map, excavate, and conserve the site. Using laser theodolite surveying technology we have collected over 100,000 measured points, documenting the site topography, exterior architecture, and exterior sculptures, and the internal labyrinthine passageways known as the galleries. Dozens of excavations and conservation interventions have greatly increased our knowledge of the site, made spectacular finds, and left the site in ever-improving condition for long-term conservation and tourist visitation. We are now embarking on major excavations of the primary ritual structures, and also of the extensive underground passages in the site, with surprising results. Another project just beginning is evaluating the acoustic design of the well-preserved architecture, to see if there was intentional manipulation of sound during Chavin rituals. Individual students have conducted their own research at the site, resulting in undergraduate honors theses on significant topics such as site construction labor and the feline-human sculptures known as tenon heads.</p>
<p>Students participating in the Chavin fieldwork are funded through VPUE, and will be in Peru for about 7 weeks during July and August. Application process takes place around the beginning of the year.</p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-f71231e1cb711842fd95bf227fa6a0a8">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div><div id="block-views-stanford-media-media" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-media view-id-stanford_media view-display-id-media view-dom-id-3d4e0a2ea6342db59819456ba314b701">

        <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Franz Boas Summer Scholars </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-984" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/undergraduate-program/research-opportunities/summer-research-opportunities-funding/franz-boas-summer-scholars" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Franz Boas Summer Scholars" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Through the special Franz Boas fund, students may apply for funding of any anthropological research, including research in the subfields of linguistics, archaeology, ethnology, and biological anthropology. Students must work with a faculty advisor appointed in the Department of Anthropology throughout the research period, apply for a supplemental grant from Undergraduate Advising and Research, and submit a non-medical human subjects protocol for approval. The exact number of grants awarded will vary from year to year depending on the quality of applications submitted and the funds available. Franz Boas grants are awarded for field research conducted in the summer. Grant recipients must enroll in ANTHRO 93, Pre field Research Seminar in the spring quarter before departing for the summer field research and in ANTHRO 94, Post field Research Seminar in the autumn quarter after returning from the summer field research. On notification of a funding award, Boas Summer Scholars must write a letter to the donor explaining briefly how their grant funds will be used and how this project will contribute to the student’s education and future goals. Stanford undergraduates who will be returning to Stanford University to matriculate in the following autumn quarter as undergraduates or Coterminal Masters students are eligible to apply. Priority will be given to honors candidates majoring in Anthropology.</p>
<h4>Application Process</h4>
<p>See <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/undergraduate-forms-and-references">FORMS</a> to download an application. Please refer to the application for deadline and contact information.</p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-27a26e75f78c0dfacd47350230bea464">

        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Michelle Z. Rosaldo Summer Field Research Grant </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-986" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/undergraduate-program/research-opportunities/summer-research-opportunities-funding/michelle-z" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Michelle Z. Rosaldo Summer Field Research Grant" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>A memorial fund which will be used for an annual award to a Stanford undergraduate to aid in carrying out summer ethnographic field research. Students must work with a faculty advisor appointed in the Department of Anthropology throughout the research period, apply for a supplemental grant from Undergraduate Advising and Research, and submit a non-medical human subjects protocol for approval. Preference will be given to projects concerning issues in feminist thought or symbolic anthropology. Michelle Z. Rosaldo grants are awarded for field research conducted in the summer. Grant recipients must enroll in ANTHRO 93, Pre field Research Seminar in the spring quarter before departing for the summer field research and in ANTHRO 94, Post field Research Seminar in the autumn quarter after returning from the summer field research. On notification of a funding award, Rosaldo Summer Scholars must write a letter to the donor explaining briefly how their grant funds will be used and how this project will contribute to the student’s education and future goals. Stanford undergraduates who will be returning to Stanford University to matriculate in the following autumn quarter as undergraduates or Coterminal Masters students are eligible to apply. Priority will be given to honors candidates majoring in Anthropology.</p>
<h4>Application Process</h4>
<p>See <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/forms-and-documents/undergraduate-forms-and-references">FORMS</a> to download an application. Please refer to the application for deadline and contact information.</p>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-b61c119e1f414ed0735fe0df921a1d2e">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div><div id="block-views-stanford-media-media" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-media view-id-stanford_media view-display-id-media view-dom-id-288921ab694d904ed2e79bdfec633bac">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">

<div id="footer" class="clearfix footer site-footer">
  <div class="container">
        <div id="footer-content" class="row-fluid footer-content"> <div class="region region-footer clearfix">
  <div id="block-menu-menu-footer-about-menu" class="clearfix block block-menu span2">     <h2>Academics</h2>

The field season usually takes place in July and August, and most travel and living expenses for qualified students are funded through Stanford University&#039;s Vice Provost for Undergraduate Education (VPUE)." />

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Excavation Site Opportunities (Field Schools) </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-169" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/undergraduate-program/research/excavation-site-opportunities-field-schools" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Excavation Site Opportunities (Field Schools)" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-image group_s_postcard_image"><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-info field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-large-scaled field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/79" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="border-simple-nowidth border-shadow"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/large-scaled/public/catal.jpg?itok=t47n0dG5" width="270" height="115" alt="Catalhoyuk dig site" /></div></div></div></div><div class="caption"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-caption field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Catalhoyuk excavation site</p>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h3>Catalhoyuk</h3>
<p>Since 2003, Stanford University's professor Ian Hodder has been taking a small number of undergraduate students (5-8 per season) on his long-running, international excavation at Çatalhöyük, near Konya, Turkey.</p>
<p>The field season usually takes place in July and August, and most travel and living expenses for qualified students are funded through Stanford University's Vice Provost for Undergraduate Education (VPUE).</p>
<p>The current excavations under the direction of Ian Hodder began in 1993. The site is a 9000-year-old town in central Turkey. It is famous for its great size (about 13 hectares) at an early date and its rich art and symbolism. The specific aims starting in 2003 are to use extensive excavation methods to open up larger areas of the site so that overall community structure can be studied, and so that larger numbers of buildings can be put on display for tourism.</p>
<p>The students spend 4 weeks learning basic excavation methods (use of tools, soil description, sampling, artifact collection and analysis, recording, drawing, photography, data entry). They also have the opportunity to work more closely on the artifacts, bones, seeds, geology, digital recording, and conservation. The students create the primary data through excavation, and do most of the initial recording and classification. Çatalhöyük is one of the few sites where sampling and study strategies can be observed and learned on site due to the large number of specialists in residence.</p>
<p>In contrast to other excavation projects offered through Stanford, Çatalhöyük requires very early registration for interested undergraduates. Because the Turkish government requires students' names to be listed on permit applications by the start of November, we must select undergraduate students in early October of each year .</p>
<p>For more information, see <a href="http://www.catalhoyuk.com" rel="nofollow">www.catalhoyuk.com</a>.</p>
</div></div></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-9f8581f74d363ef599e6512ae5b6b3c1">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div><div id="block-views-stanford-media-media" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-media view-id-stanford_media view-display-id-media view-dom-id-728236530a3502632b01645178c5e2b5">

  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jsa-layouts-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Undergraduate Program</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jsa_layouts-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Summer Research Opportunities &amp; Funding </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-171" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/undergraduate-program/research/summer-research-opportunities-funding" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Summer Research Opportunities &amp; Funding" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><div class="ug-research"><a href="http://web.stanford.edu/group/beagle2/index.html" target="_blank"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/beagle2.jpg" width="175" length="175" /><h4>Beagle 2</h4>
<p></p></a>
   </div>
<div class="ug-research"><a href="http://web.stanford.edu/group/hopes/cgi-bin/hopes_test/about-2/" target="_blank"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/hopes.jpg" width="175" length="175" /><h4>Hopes</h4>
<p></p></a>
   </div>
<div class="ug-research"><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/research-opportunities/summer-research-opportunities-funding/chavin"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/chavin1.jpg" width="175" length="175" /><h4>Chavin</h4>
<p></p></a>
   </div>
<div class="ug-research"><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/research-opportunities/summer-research-opportunities-funding/franz-boas-summer-scholars"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/suemblem1_0.png" width="175" length="175" /><h4>Franz Boas</h4>
<p></p></a>
   </div>
<div class="ug-research"><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/undergraduate-program/research-opportunities/summer-research-opportunities-funding/michelle-z"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/suemblem1_0.png" width="175" length="175" /><h4>Michelle Rosaldo</h4>
<p></p></a>
   </div>
<div class="ug-research"><img src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/tambopata.png" width="175" length="175" /><h4 style="margin-bottom:0; padding-bottom:0;">Tambopata</h4>
<p style="margin:0; padding:0; text-align:center; color:#000;">Not offered 2016-2017</p>
<!-- website: stanford.edu/group/tro /--></div>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>

  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jsa-layouts-1" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Undergraduate Program</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jsa_layouts-1 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-2850"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program" title="">Undergraduate Program Overview</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2518"><a href="/undergraduate-program/mission-and-learning-outcomes">Mission and Learning Outcomes</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-mlid-2784"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/anthro/undergraduate-program/major" title="">Degree Requirements</a></li>

        </div>
        <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Travel Research Opportunities </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-173" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/undergraduate-program/research/travel-research-opportunities" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Travel Research Opportunities" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-image group_s_postcard_image"><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-info field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-large-scaled field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/81" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="border-simple-nowidth border-shadow"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/large-scaled/public/sophomore-college.jpg?itok=YahpfT-P" width="270" height="175" alt="sophomore college" /></div></div></div></div><div class="caption"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-caption field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Map of Galapagos Islands</p>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h3>Sophomore College Course and Field Seminar</h3>
<p>This September, the Anthropology Department, in conjunction with Sophomore College and the Stanford Alumni Association, will again offer a special educational opportunity for Stanford sophomores of all majors: a course on "Darwin, Evolution, and Galapagos" including a 10-day Field Seminar to the Galapagos Islands of Ecuador, South America. This course is the fifteenth in a rotating annual series of Field Seminars that are designed to enhance the experiential learning opportunities of the Stanford curriculum (other seminars in the series include travel to the Amazon, Costa Rica, and elsewhere). In each case, a Sophomore College course ends with a trip to experience first-hand one or more of the places studied in class. After a preparatory seminar of their own, adult alumni and friends of the University join the class for the travel component.</p>
</div></div></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">

      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>

      <div class="view-content">

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> CONTEXTS: Stanford Undergraduate Research Journal in Anthropology </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-89" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/undergraduate-program/ug-research-journal" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="CONTEXTS: Stanford Undergraduate Research Journal in Anthropology" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div class="postcard"><div class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h4>About CONTEXTS</h4>
<p>Contexts is an annual publication comprised of scholarly articles and reviews (book, film, art, and event reviews) written by Stanford undergraduates in all academic fields. The mission of Contexts is to provide a forum for students to share, discuss, and reflect upon social issues in a manner that demonstrates anthropological thought and modes of inquiry. CONTEXTS is published electronically on the web, with print issues released annually. For current as well as previous issues of undergrad journal, please see <a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/department/publications/ug-research-journal">Undergrad Journal</a>.</p>
<h4>Who may submit research articles to CONTEXTS?</h4>
<ul><li>Current Stanford undergraduates who conducted research either at Stanford or elsewhere.</li>
	<li>Primary authors must be undergraduate students. Recent graduates may submit manuscripts for research conducted during their undergraduate careers. Manuscripts should be submitted no more than a year after the author’s graduation.</li>
</ul><h4>Copyright and Publishing</h4>
<p>Work published in CONTEXTS may be published elsewhere. However, please be conscious of other journals’ policy regarding exclusivity of rights, and keep CONTEXTS informed as to where your paper has been or may be published.</p>
<h4>General Guidelines</h4>
<ul><li>Submit the following via email to <a href="mailto:Stanford.contexts@gmail.com" rel="nofollow">Stanford.contexts@gmail.com</a>:
		<ol><li>research article in .doc, .docx, or .rtf,</li>
			<li>must follow AAA Style Guide for writing &amp; citations found at: <a href="http://www.aaanet.org/publications/style_guide.pdf" title="http://www.aaanet.org/publications/style_guide.pdf" rel="nofollow">http://www.aaanet.org/publications/style_guide.pdf</a> &amp; <a href="http://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/6656347" title="http://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/6656347">http://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/6656347</a></li>
			<li>an abstract (~150-200 words).</li>
			<li>related images,</li>
			<li>headshot photo and a small bio of yourself stating your year, major, and a few of your academic and/or personal interests,</li>
			<li><a href="https://anthropology.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/contexts_author_agreement.pdf">Contexts Author Agreement</a></li>
		</ol></li>
	<li>Acceptable submissions need not be summaries of ongoing or past research projects. We also consider research-oriented papers from Stanford classes.</li>
	<li>Article length should be ~2000-3000 words. Shorter or longer submissions are fine; editors will work with you to bring your paper to an acceptable length. Further length modification may be necessary at journal production time due to space constraints.</li>
</ul></div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-res-by-topic field-type-list-boolean field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
  </div>
                                                                                                            <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-dc63736c92d1ba67e9f6a61ed6c30382" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-publications-author view-id-stanford_publications_author view-display-id-block_2 view-dom-id-7aa35d058ca7bd2378060469f6a141a7">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div><div id="block-views-stanford-media-media" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-media view-id-stanford_media view-display-id-media view-dom-id-71a099fbc77ea215e3bbe5adc7160045">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last views-article">
      
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>

</div></div>
